integrations.name: Adobe Sign
integrations.description:
E-signatures keep work moving.

Get contracts signed, loans approved, and deals done faster with e-signatures from Adobe. Adobe Sign combines the power of Adobe e-signatures with industry-leading PDF tools. SSO with Auth0 allows for your users and customers to sign on with a single credential, sign, and quickly track documents.
integrations.short_description: SSO for Adobe Sign
integrations.install_guide:
The Adobe Sign SSO Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Adobe Sign. Your users log in to Adobe Sign with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for an Adobe Sign account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Custom DomainDomain of your Adobe Sign URL (https://{domain}.echosign.com).
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Adobe Sign.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Adobe Sign To configure the integration with Adobe Sign, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Adobe Sign. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

install_guide_json.content: The Adobe Sign SSO Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Adobe Sign. Your users log in to Adobe Sign with Auth0 identity providers, which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • Sign up for an Adobe Sign account.
  • Set up a connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

SettingDescription
Custom DomainDomain of your Adobe Sign URL (https://{domain}.echosign.com).
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Adobe Sign.

Configure integration with Adobe Sign

To configure the integration with Adobe Sign, follow the instructions listed in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Adobe Sign. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view.
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

The steps in this guide are valid for Active Directory Rights Management Services 2008 and earlier.

Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • Sign up for an AD RMS account.
  • Set up a connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

SettingDescription
Rights Management Services URLURL of your Active Directory Rights Management Server.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of AD RMS.

Configure integration with AD RMS

Enable connections

integrations.name: Aha!
integrations.description: Aha! is a product roadmap software that enables product managers and marketing teams to define the why, when, and what of products, before actually building one. It is a tool that helps users establish their product strategy, capture ideas in one place, create details, update status, and easily share roadmaps with customers and colleagues. It is a solution that allows them to measure and learn what is being developed in a customizable software that works for your team.
integrations.short_description: The World's #1 Roadmap Software
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Aha! account](https://www.aha.io/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.aha.io/auth/saml/callback`|

## Configure integration with Aha!

To configure the integration with **Aha!**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to **Settings** -> **Account** -> **Security and single sign-on** and select the **SAML 2.0** provider. 
2. This will display the SSO settings. Give a name for the provider (required).
3. You are able to configure **Aha!** in three different ways.
    - The easiest way is to use the **Metadata URL** option. Copy the metadata URL from Auth0 configurations, enter the URL, and click Enable. **Aha!** will download the file and configure everything for you.
    - You can download the file by yourself and provide it to **Aha!** with the **Metadata File** option.
    - The last option is the **Manual Settings**. Only two things are needed the SSO endpoint and the certificate fingerprint.

For more details, you can follow **Aha!** [tutorial](https://www.aha.io/support/roadmaps/account/single-sign-on/configure-sso-saml-2-point-0).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Aha!. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Airbrake
integrations.description: Airbrake is a cloud-based error and bug reporting solution that caters to development teams in small and midsize organizations. The features of this solution include backlog management, filtering, ticket management, issue tracking and workforce management.
integrations.short_description: Frictionless Error Monitoring and Application Performance Management
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Airbrake account](https://airbrake.io/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.airbrake.io/users/saml/acs`|

## Configure integration with Airbrake

To configure the integration with **Airbrake**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Airbrake.
2. Click on **User Icon** > **Account & Billing** > **Security** 
3. Click on **Enable SAML**
4. Paste the Identity Provider Metadata URL into the **SAML/IdP Metadata URL** field.
5. Press **Enable SAML SSO** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Airbrake** [docs](https://airbrake.io/docs/features/saml-single-sign-on/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Airbrake. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: AlertOps
integrations.description:
AlertOps is an Alerting & Real-time Ops tool that helps teams respond to business-critical incidents faster. 
With AlertOps you get:
   - Total Flexibility, no compromises.
   - End-to-end Workflow Automation.
   - Expert Guidance, on-demand.
integrations.short_description: Resolve Major Incidents & Automate Real-time Operations
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [AlertOps account](https://alertops.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.alertops.com/login.aspx`|
| Audience | Audience URL `https://{domain}.alertops.com`|

## Configure integration with AlertOps

To configure the integration with **AlertOps**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your AlertOps website and click **Account Settings** in the menu-bar
2. Click the **SSO** tab. Check the **Use Single Sign-On (SSO)**.
3. **SSO Provider**: Select Other as SSO Provider
4. **Issuer URL**: Copy the Issuer URL.
5. **SAML endpoint URL**: Copy the Identity Provider Login URL
6. **SAML Signature Algorithm**: Choose SHA256
7. **X.509 Certificate**: Open the Identity Provider Certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it.
8. Click **Save**.

For more details, you can follow **AlertOps** [docs](https://help.alertops.com/en/articles/2097660-generic-sso-provider-configuration).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to AlertOps. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: AnyPoint
integrations.description:
Allow all your team to securely access AnyPoint with a Single Sign-On. With AnyPoint you can build APIs and integrations with clicks or code.

Use Mule, a lightweight, scalable runtime engine for APIs, integrations, and microservices. Deploy anywhere with our hybrid integration platform — on-premises, on the cloud, or both.
integrations.short_description: Connect with MuleSoft's platform for APIs and integrations
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an MuleSoft AnyPoint account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://anypoint.mulesoft.com/accounts/login/{organization}/providers/{id}/receive-id`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within MuleSoft AnyPoint like `https://{domain}.anypoint.mulesoft.com` |

## Configure integration with MuleSoft AnyPoint

To configure the integration with MuleSoft AnyPoint, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. From the main menu go to **Management Center / Access Management**
2. In the next menu go to **Identity Providers**
3. Here you will find and click on the *SAML 2.0* settings
4. Fill in the Auth0 SSO settings.
   1. Make sure to set *Audience* to: `<OrganizationDomain>.anypoint.mulesoft.com`. This is the *Audience* field that we need to provide to Auth0.
   1. Set *Username Attribute* to `http://schemas.auth0.com/nickname`
   1. Set *First Name Attribute* to `http://schemas.auth0.com/given_name`
   1. Set *Last Name Attribute* to `http://schemas.auth0.com/family_name`
   1. Set *Email Attribute* to `http://schemas.auth0.com/email`
   1. Copy the *Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL*. We need to provide this field to Auth0.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to MuleSoft AnyPoint. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: AppDynamics
integrations.description:
AppDynamics is a leading application performance management (APM) and IT operations analytics (ITOA). It is a tool that monitors your Application Infrastructure and gives you code level visibility. 
It is supported for all major technologies (Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, NOSQL etc) and can be installed either as on-premise or as SaaS (Software As a Service) solution.
integrations.short_description: The world's # 1 APM solution
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [AppDynamics account](https://www.appdynamics.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}/controller/saml-auth?accountName={account_name}`|
| Audience | Audience URI (Service Provider Entity ID) `https://{domain}/controller`|

* You can find your AppDynamics `account_name` in **Setting** > **Licence** > **Account**. The account name appears next to the Name label.
* Make sure the Callback and Audience URLs are secure URLs beginning with `https`

## Configure integration with AppDynamics

To configure the integration with **AppDynamics**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Navigate to your Controller.
2. Log in as the Account Owner.
3. As a user with AppDynamics account administrator privileges in the Controller UI, click **Settings** > **Administration**.
4. Click the **Authentication Provider** tab and select **SAML**.
5. In the **SAML Configuration** section enter the following SAML configuration settings:
    - **Login URL**: the Identity Provider Login URL from Tutorial view.
    - **Login URL Method**: POST.
    - **Logout URL**: leave the default value.
    - **Identity Provider Certificate**: click on edit and paste the certificate.
6. Leave the **SAML Attribute Mappings** in blank.
7. **SAML Group Mappings** can be changed if needed.

For more details, you can follow **AppDynamics** [docs](https://docs.appdynamics.com/display/PRO21/Configure+Basic+SAML+Authentication).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to AppDynamics. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: AssetSonar
integrations.description: Ensure software compliance, optimize software spend, and always be audit-ready with an advanced license management solution. Take complete control of both installed and cloud software with our license tracking, utilization tracking, audits, mobile app, and integrations with service desks like Zendesk & Jira. Our easy-to-use software ensures you instantly bounce back from all compliance issues.
integrations.short_description: Powerful and Intuitive IT Asset Management Software
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [AssetSonar account](https://www.assetsonar.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.assetsonar.com/users/auth/saml/callback`|

## Configure integration with AssetSonar

To configure the integration with **AssetSonar**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to AssetSonar.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Settings** 
3. Click on **Addons** and search for **SAML Integration**.
4. In the **SAML Settings** section at the bottom of the page you need to enter the following value.
    - **Identity Provider URL**: Identity Provider Login URL
    - **Identity Provider Certificate**: Copy and paste the content of the Identity Provider Certificate
5. In the **Attribute Mapping** section enter the following values:
    - First Name: first_name
    - Last Name: last_name
    - Email: email
6. Customize roles if needed.
7. Press **Update** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **AssetSonar** [docs](https://blog.assetsonar.com/azure-ad-single-sign-on-sso-e1dbd42d03a8).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to AssetSonar. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Purpose built to work with your SaaS toolset, IT, HR and Operations teams get more done where they work and resolve requests faster with one central command center, backed by intuitive ticketing, a dynamic knowledge base, and end-to-end machine learning. Employees get convenient and immediate self-help in the tools they already use with conversational omnichannel experience. With atSpoke, organizations are able to unlock their workforce’ productivity and move work forward faster.
integrations.short_description: One modern service desk for all your internal support needs
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [atSpoke account](https://www.atspoke.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.askspoke.com/saml/callback`|

* You will find the **Callback URL** at the end of the **atSpoke** config form.

## Configure integration with atSpoke

To configure the integration with **atSpoke**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to atSpoke.
2. Navigate to **Settings** and select the **Integrations** menu.
3. Find the SAML tile and choose **Connect**.
4. Enter the following values:
    - Sign-on URL
    - Issuer
    - Public certificate
5. Click on **Test SAML connection**. This will test the current SAML configuration and if everything is set up correctly you can enable SAML for all your current users.

For more details, you can follow **atSpoke** [docs](https://help.atspoke.com/article/r21ztf1r8p-saml-single-sign-on).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to atSpoke. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Axomo account](https://axomo.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://api.axomo.com/v3/{domain}/SAML2/`|

## Configure integration with Axomo

To configure the integration with **Axomo**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Axomo.
2. Click on **User Management** > **User Settings** 
3. Scroll to **Enable Single Sign On** and click on **Enable SAML2 Authentication**.
4. Rename the **Name Application ID** as you see fit.
5. Open and Copy the Identity Provider Certificate and paste it into the **Saml Signing Certificate** field.
6. Paste the Issuer into the **IDP Issuer** field.
7. Paste the Identity Provider Login URL into the **Login URL** field.
8. Leave **Login ID** as Email.
7. Press **OK** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Axomo** [docs](https://saml-doc.okta.com/SAML_Docs/How-to-Configure-SAML-2.0-for-Axomo.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Axomo. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Our HR software collects and organizes all the information you gather throughout the employee life cycle, then helps you use it to achieve great things. Whether you’re hiring, onboarding, preparing compensation, or building culture, BambooHR gives you the time and insights to focus on your most important asset—your people.
integrations.short_description: BambooHR® lets you focus on people, not processes
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [BambooHR! account](https://www.bamboohr.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.bamboohr.com/saml/consume.php`|
| Audience URL | The audience URL. (Usually the same as the Callback URL)  `https://{domain}.bamboohr.com/saml/consume.php`|

## Configure integration with BambooHR

To configure the integration with **BambooHR**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your BambooHR at `https://{domain}.bamboohr.com` and sign in with your credentials.
2. Go to **Settings** -> **Apps**. Search for the **SAML Single Sign‑On** app and install it.
3. Enter the "**SSO Login URL**", the "**x.509 Certificate**" and click "Install".
4. Once saved, users can log into BambooHR using their SAML account.

For more details, you can follow **BambooHR** [tutorial](https://help.bamboohr.com/hc/en-us/articles/224726367-Third-Party-SAML).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to BambooHR. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Blocksedit account](https://blocksedit.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{id}.app.blocksedit.com/sso`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://{domain}.blocksedit.com` |


## Configure integration with Blocks Edit

To configure the integration with **Blocks Edit**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to [Blocks Edit](https://app.blocksedit.com/login/).
2. Click on **User Name** > **My Account** 
3. Scroll to **Integrations** and click on **Add** on the **Single Sign On** option.
4. Scroll to **Identity Provider SAML** section.
5. Copy and Paste the Identity Provider Metadata URL into the **Metadata URL** field.
6. Click on **Update** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow the [Blocks Edit docs](https://blocksedit.com/help/integrations/single-sign-on-setup/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Blocks Edit. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Bonusly makes work better for everyone, from the new hire to the CEO. It empowers teams across the world to recognize and reward one another for the great work they do day in, and day out.

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Bonusly.

integrations.description:
With Box, you get a single place to manage, secure, share and govern all of the content for your internal and external collaboration and processes.

Secure your Box account with Auth0 to take control over application access, create and enforce security policies, and add two-factor authentication.
integrations.short_description: Give users quick low effort access to Box through Auth0
integrations.install_guide:
The Box [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Box. Your users log in to Box with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a [Box Enterprise account](https://www.box.com/).
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Box

To configure the integration with Box, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Box. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.name: Brightfunds
integrations.description:
Bright Funds powers a technology platform that makes workplace giving, volunteerism, and grants management more effective for companies, more meaningful for employees, and more impactful for the world.

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Brightfunds.
integrations.short_description: Welcome to the forefront of workplace philanthropy
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Brightfunds account](https://hello.brightfunds.org/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.brightfunds.org/auth/saml/consume`|
| Audience | Your target audience `https://{domain}.brightfunds.org/auth/saml/consume`|

## Configure integration with Brightfunds

To configure the integration with **Brightfunds**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log into your **Brightfunds** as an administrator.
2. Go to the **Admin Dashboard** clicking on the user profile picture.
3. Click on **Settings** > **Log In Settings** and click **Manage** on the **Single Sign-On** section.
4. Select **Enable Single Sign-On**.
5. On the **Sign-On URL** enter the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
6. Go to the **Certificates** section. Enter a certificate name (Auth0) and paste the content of the **Identity Provider Certificate**. Click **Add New Certificate**.
7. Click **Save** at the bottom of the page.

You can enable the **Auto Provision User** to provision new users. Leave other fields with the default values.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Brightfunds. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login |

Depending on the region the Callback URL could be one of the following:
- https://red-us.mysecuredatavault.com/AssertionConsumerService.aspx
- https://red-apac.mysecuredatavault.com/AssertionConsumerService.aspx
- https://red-fr.mysecuredatavault.com/AssertionConsumerService.aspx
- https://red-emea.mysecuredatavault.com/AssertionConsumerService.aspx

## Configure integration with Carbonite

To configure the integration with **Carbonite**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your Carbonite website and click on **Company** from the left pane.
2. Click on **Single sign-on**.
3. Click on Enable and configure the following values:
    - In **Identity provider ID** paste the **Issuer** URN.
    - In **Identity provider URL** paste the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
    - Download the certificate from Auth0 an upload it in **Identity provider certificate**.
4. Click **Save**.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Carbonite. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Cisco WebEx
integrations.description: Webex SSO uses one unique identifier to give people in your organization access to all enterprise applications. Administrators can use Webex Site Administration to configure SSO for Cisco Webex applications. With Auth0 you can integrate SSO with your organization in Cisco Webex Control Hub. SSO lets your users use a single, common set of credentials for Webex Meetings, Webex Teams, and other applications in your organization. Site administrators have the option to set up their organization with single sign-on (SSO). SSO lets people use one set of credentials to sign in to multiple applications.
integrations.short_description: Let your users use a single, common set of credentials for Webex Meetings
integrations.install_guide:
The Cisco WebEx [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Cisco WebEx. Your users log in to Cisco WebEx with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a Cisco WebEx account.
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Cisco WebEx

To configure the integration with Cisco WebEx, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Cisco WebEx. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.name: Cloudentity
integrations.description:
Cloudentity externalizes authorization away from client and backend services allowing developers to build services faster with out of the box integrations to enforce policies anywhere, including leading API gateways, Kubernetes, Service Meshes and FAAS platforms. We make it easier to deliver cloud-native apps and safer to extend your data to the customers, partners and services that drive your business. 

Cloudentity enables secure data sharing and delivers compliance for Open banking and other regulated industries to secure B2B data sharing.   Our standards-based solution provides advanced OAuth capabilities like mTLS, CIBA and RAR, with rich policy management to secure APIs with fine-grained authorization.

Together Cloudentity and Auth0 provide:

* Pre-configured workspaces supporting Open Banking Uk, Brazil, FDX and CDR  
* Fine-Grained policies for consent management, API Authorization, and tamper-proof audit  
* Dynamic enforcement for all apps and API access / data exchange at the transaction level  
* Data Traceability that tracks how, when, where and under what conditions (consent, fraud and customer authentication types) data is shared with partners, developers, gig workers and other third parties.
integrations.short_description: Frictionless Open Banking and secure data sharing
integrations.install_guide:
Getting started with Cloudentity is easy to protect your modern applications and services using open standards and dynamic authorization. 

Here are instructions on how Cloudentity enables users in Auth0 platform to get authorization tokens from Cloudentity platform. 

## Prerequisites

1. An Auth0 account and tenant. [Sign up for free here](https://auth0.com/signup).
2. A Cloudentity SaaS tenant. [Sign up for free here](https://authz.cloudentity.io/register).

## Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration

1. Select **Add Integration** (at the top of this page).
2. Read the necessary access requirements and click **Continue**.
3. Enter a **Name** then configure the integration using the following fields:
    * Add audience (Obtained after registering app in Cloudentity under `Entity issuer` field)
    * Add Callback URL (Obtained after registering app in Cloudentity under `Redirect URL` field)
4. Click **Save** to enable the SSO integration.
5. Click the **Connections** tab to [configure the sources of identity to use](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/applications/update-application-connections).

## Configure Cloudentity

To configure the integration with Cloudentity, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view.

1. Sign in to [your Cloudentity tenant](https://authz.cloudentity.io).
2. Choose existing or create a new authorization workspace.
3. In your workspace, go to **Identity Data** > **Identity Providers** > **Create Identity**.
4. Select `SAML` under Enterprise Connections.
5. In the form, enter the **Sign-in URL** and **IDP certificate Client ID** obtained from Auth0 application configuration in previous section.
​
    Parameter | Description
    --------- | ----------
    Sign-in URL | URL pointing to your SAML IDP application’s SSO endpoint. Enter an initial dummy value to pass form validation if you don’t have this app yet..
    IDP certificate | Certificate of your SAML IDP application. You need to obtain it from the application itself.
​
6. Optionally, enable **Authentication context caching**
7. Select **Save**.

For advanced integration configurations with Cloudentity, [follow this article](https://developer.cloudentity.com/howtos/identities/saml/) and explore [Cloudentity authorization platform capabilities](https://developer.cloudentity.com/get_started/)

Test out the integration between Auth0 and Cloudentity by following the guide [here](https://developer.cloudentity.com/howtos/identities/auth0/#test-auth0-idp)

## Troubleshooting

1. [Audit events are available to monitor critical events in the system](https://developer.cloudentity.com/howtos/access_control/getting_bussiness_audit_data/)

2. [Raise a ticket in Cloudentity support portal in case of any issues](https://cloudentity.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/20)

integrations.name: cloudtamer.io
integrations.description:
[cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io)  is comprehensive cloud governance software that allows you to manage your cloud presence at scale. With [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io) , your team can easily request and manage cloud resources that are aligned with your budget, security, and compliance policies. [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io)  fully integrates with Auth0 as a SAML 2.0 provider.
This integration allows users to access [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io)  using familiar logins, consolidates user management, and provides the ability to filter based on roles to automatically assign access upon login.
integrations.short_description: cloudtamer.io fully integrates with Auth0 as a SAML 2.0 provider
integrations.install_guide:
# Configuring Auth0 for cloudtamer.io

Follow these steps to configure Auth0 and [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io) together:
1. Within the Auth0 Marketplace listing for [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io), select **Add Integration**.
1. The tenent picker will appear and prompt you to select which tenant you'd like to use.
1. The consent screen will then appear. Grant Auth0 the access it needs.
1. Login to [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io) as an admin and begin creating the SAML 2.0 IDMS with these settings, which are available in **Tutorial** tab of the dashboard once this integration is installed:
    1. Auth0 Issuer = Identity Provider Issuer
    1. Download the meta-data from Auth0 and paste it into the Identity Provider Metadata field.
    1. Select "Enable Custom Login URL" and paste the Identity Provider Login URL value.
    1. Under assertion mapping:
        1. First Name: first_name
        1. Last Name: last_name
        1. Email: email
        1. Username: email
    1. Select **Create IDMS**.
1. Scroll to the bottom of the dialog and select **Enable**.
1. Close the SAML2 Web App dialog (if still open).
1. Auth0 supports the concept of Roles in order to establish access within an external application. With this in mind, we provide a templated approach that uses the built-in Roles concept and then uses Auth0 Actions to pass this across to [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io). Follow the steps below for this approach:
    1. For each of the different groups that you create within cloudtamer.io for access, you should create a representative role within Auth0 under User Management > Roles.
        1. NOTE: You do not need to assign any permission to these Roles as this is done within cloudtamer.io's mappings, not Auth0.
        1. As an example, we have the default Administrators group within [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io). We will create a cloudtamer-Admins Role within Auth0.
    1. Assign each of the users to the roles that you create within Auth0.
    1. Within Auth0, navigate to the Actions > Custom section.
    1. Select **Create** to create a new action.
    1. On the dialog that appears, enter a name such as **Apply Roles** and set Trigger to **Login/Post Login**. Click **Create** to create the new Action.
    1. In the editor that appears, update the code to read like this:
        ```javascript
        exports.onExecutePostLogin = async (event, api) => {
          if (event.authorization) {
            api.idToken.setCustomClaim('roles', event.authorization.roles);
          }
        };
        ```
    1. Select **Deploy** to create the Action.
    1. Within Auth0, navigate to the Actions > Flows section.
    1. Select Login from the list that appears.
    1. Select your new action (such as Apply Roles) from the list on the right and drag it onto the flow between **Start** and **Complete** as shown below:
       ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/cloudtamer/media/cloudtamer-step-10.png)
    1. Select **Apply** to apply this new flow.
    1. For versions 2.28.x or older, use these instructions to configure role to group mappings:
        1. Back within [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io) and as an Administrator, navigate to Users > Identity Management Systems.
        1. Locate the IDMS you created from the list and select the dots menu on the right-hand side.
        1. Choose **Edit** from the menu that appears.
        1. Scroll down to the User Group Associations section. For each of the roles that you created, select **New User Group Association** and fill in the following parameters in the fields that appear:
            1. Name should be `http://schemas.auth0.com/roles`
            1. Regex should be the role you created in this formation: `^[ROLENAME]$`
                1. For example, a role named `cloudtamer-Admins` would use `^cloudtamer-Admins$`.
            1. User Group should be the associated user group, such as Administrators.
            1. Check the **Should update on Login** field.
            1. After all roles have been added, select **Update IDMS** to complete the configuration.
    1. For versions 2.29.0 or newer, use these instructions to configure role to group mappings:
        1. Back within [cloudtamer.io](https://cloudtamer.io) and as an Administrator, navigate to Users > Identity Management Systems.
        1. Select the new IDMS that you created in order to view it.
        1. On the IDMS page, select **User Group Associations**.
        1. For each of the roles, select **Add** > Add New and fill in the following parameters on the dialog that appears:
            1. Name should be `http://schemas.auth0.com/roles`
            1. Regex should be the role you created in this formation: `^[ROLENAME]$`
                1. For example, a role named `cloudtamer-Admins` would use `^cloudtamer-Admins$`.
            1. User Group should be the associated user group, such as Administrators.
            1. Check the **Update on Login** field.
            1. Select **Add** to complete this entry.
    1. Configuration of Roles is now complete.
1. Configuration of the IDMS is now complete.

integrations.name: CoderPad
integrations.description: CoderPad is a technical interview platform for leading development teams. It enables a quick, accurate read on a candidate’s skills. CoderPad works like an IDE to help candidates easily share their skills and ensure you understand how they work. Through both collaborative coding sessions and take-home assignments, CoderPad is with you at every stage of the hiring process.
integrations.short_description: The Leading Technical Interview Platform
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [CoderPad account](https://coderpad.io/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://coderpad.io/saml/acs`|

## Configure integration with CoderPad

To configure the integration with **CoderPad**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to CoderPad.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Team Settings** 
3. Click on **Configure Single Sign On**
4. Upload the Identity Provider Metadata file into the **SAML XML metadata file** field.
6. Customize subdomain if needed.
7. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **CoderPad** [docs](https://coderpad.io/resources/docs/account/sso/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to CoderPad. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
The Concur [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Concur. Your users log in to Concur with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a Concur account.
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Concur

To configure the integration with Concur, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Concur. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.name: Databox
integrations.description:
Databox pulls all your data into one place, so you can track performance and discover insights in real-time.

Connect your data from any tool and track it from any device. No more logging into dozens of different tools to understand performance — now you and your team can easily connect your data, build and share reports, monitor trends, and discover insights.
integrations.short_description: Databox pulls all your data into one place
integrations.install_guide:
Databox pulls all your data into one place, so you can track performance and discover insights in real-time. With SSO you can easy login in Databox through auth0.

## Prerequisites

1. An Auth0 account and tenant. [Sign up for free here](https://auth0.com/signup).
2. Before you begin:
    - Sign up for a Databox account, if not already.
    - In **Account Details → SSO** you will find SSO configuration that you will enter after completing auth0 setup.

## Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration

1. Select **Add Integration** (at the top of this page).
1. Read the necessary access requirements and click **Continue**.
1. Enter a **Name**.
1. Click **Save** to enable the SSO integration.
1. Click the **Connections** tab to [configure the sources of identity to use](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/applications/update-application-connections).

## Set up Databox

To configure the integration with Databox, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view.

1. Go to https://app.databox.com/account/sso
1. Insert the following configuration from auth0
    - **Single Sign-on URL** is auth0 Identity Provider Login URL
    - **Single Sign-on Entity ID** is auth0 Issuer
    - **X.509 Certificate** paste raw file content from .pem file

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any difficulties, please email (help@databox.com) us for assistence.

integrations.description:
To grow and thrive in the fast-paced digital era, you need an agile technology foundation that speeds the flow of information, interactions, and innovations so you can achieve better business outcomes, faster. 

Dell Boomi’s intelligent, flexible and scalable platform quickly and easily unites everything and everyone in your digital ecosystem across channels, devices, and platforms. 

With our cloud-native platform, getting started is easy – just log in and go – and you can scale it reliably and securely as you grow. Its sophisticated capabilities combined with an intuitive interface, built-in intelligence and insights from the Boomi community empower both IT and business users to get more done in less time so you can say yes to everything your business needs to succeed. 

Dell Boomi is your faster, smarter path to better business outcomes.
integrations.short_description: Instantly Connect Everyone to Everything
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Dell Boomi account](https://boomi.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://platform.boomi.com/sso/{account_id}/saml`|
| Audience | Your target audience `https://platform.boomi.com/sso/{account_id}/saml`|

* You will find this URL in the Dell Boomi SSO configuration. **Callback URL** and **Audience URL** are the same.

## Configure integration with Dell Boomi

To configure the integration with **Dell Boomi**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your Dell Boomi website and click to **Settings** > **Security Options** > **SSO Options**.
2. Select **Enable SAML Single Sing-on** check box.
3. Click **Import** and upload the **Identity Provider Certificate** file.
4. In the **Identity Provider Sign In URL** enter the **Identity Provider Login URL** from Auth0.
5. Select **Federation ID is in FEDERATION_ID Attribute element**.
6. Click **Save**

Dell Boomi uses a **Federation ID** that is unique to this service. You can configure this value in **Settings** > **Account Access** > **User Management**. You can edit each user **Federation ID**, we recommend to set this value to the user's email.

For more details, you can follow **Dell Boomi** [docs](https://help.boomi.com/bundle/integration/page/c-atm-Single_sign-on_with_SAML_authentication.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Dell Boomi. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Dropbox Single Sign On
integrations.description:
Everything you need for work, all in one place

If you're the admin of a Dropbox Business team on an Advanced or Enterprise Dropbox plan, you can enable single sign-on (SSO) for your team with Auth0. Single sign-on allows team members to access Dropbox by signing in one time through Auth0 and the credential can be shared across key tools and services. This means your team can access Dropbox without having to remember another password.
integrations.short_description: SSO allows your team to access Dropbox without having to remember another password
integrations.install_guide:
The Dropbox [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Dropbox. Your users log in to Dropbox with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a [Dropbox Business account](https://www.dropbox.com/business).
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Dropbox

To configure the integration with Dropbox, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Dropbox. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.name: Dynamics CRM
integrations.description:
Get The Full Spectrum Of CRM Through The Seamless Dynamics 365 Applications. Manage Topline Revenue. Enhance Customer Service. Drive Business Sales. Easy To Manage. Types: Cloud Based CRM, Customer Support, Automate Sales.

CRM solutions increase your profitability by streamlining administrative processes in your sales, marketing, and service divisions, and letting you focus on building and maintaining the customer relationships that matter. A strong CRM solution is a multifaceted platform where everything crucial to developing, improving, and retaining your customer relationships is stored. Without the support of an integrated CRM solution, you may miss growth opportunities and lose revenue because you’re not optimizing your operating processes or making the most of your customer relationships or sales leads.
integrations.short_description: SSO for Dynamics CRM allows your team to quickly login with a single password
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a Dynamics CRM account.
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Dynamics CRM

To configure the integration with Dynamics CRM, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Dynamics CRM SSO integration

Before you continue, make sure you have your SSO integration Client ID. You will use the Client ID to replace the `SSO_CLIENT_ID` placeholders.

![Locate Client ID](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-tutorial.png)

Provide the following SAML protocol configuration parameters:

*   SAML Version: `2.0`
    
*   Issuer: `urn:YOUR_DOMAIN`
    
*   Identity Provider Certificate: `https://YOUR_DOMAIN/pem`
    
*   Identity Provider SHA1 fingerprint: `A6:14:84:AC:34:55:FA:14:87:19:15:81:67:77:D2:59:EB:13:4B:FC`
    
*   Identity Provider Login URL (be sure to replace the SSO\_CLIENT\_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration): `https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID`
    
*   Identity Provider Metadata (be sure to replace the SSO\_CLIENT\_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration): `https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/metadata/SSO_CLIENT_ID`
    

Alternatively, to log in with a specific identity provider, you can add a `connection` parameter (be sure to replace the SSO\_CLIENT\_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration):

    https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID?connection=email
    https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID?connection=google-oauth2
    https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID?connection=Username-Password-Authentication
    

In this case, Auth0 will redirect users to the specified connection and will not display the Login widget. Make sure you send the SAMLRequest using `HTTP POST`.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Dynamics CRM. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click Save.

Configure integration with Dynamics CRM

To configure the integration with Dynamics CRM, follow the instructions listed in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

Before you continue, make sure you have your SSO integration Client ID. You will use the Client ID to replace the SSO_CLIENT_ID placeholders.

Provide the following SAML protocol configuration parameters:

  • SAML Version: 2.0
  • Issuer: urn:YOUR_DOMAIN
  • Identity Provider Certificate: https://YOUR_DOMAIN/pem
  • Identity Provider SHA1 fingerprint: A6:14:84:AC:34:55:FA:14:87:19:15:81:67:77:D2:59:EB:13:4B:FC
  • Identity Provider Login URL (be sure to replace the SSO_CLIENT_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration): https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID
  • Identity Provider Metadata (be sure to replace the SSO_CLIENT_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration): https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/metadata/SSO_CLIENT_ID

Alternatively, to log in with a specific identity provider, you can add a connection parameter (be sure to replace the SSO_CLIENT_ID placeholder with the Client ID of your SSO Integration):

https://YOUR_DOMAIN/samlp/SSO_CLIENT_ID?connection=email

integrations.name: Ekarda
integrations.description:
Conventional direct marketing wisdom says that it costs seven times as much to find and convert a prospect to a customer than it costs to retain a customer you already have. ekarda is an eCard service designed specifically for businesses.  

By taking a few minutes set-up an ekarda account, you and your staff can build rapport and strengthen business relationships by automatically sending the right greeting to the right person at the right time.

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Ekarda.
integrations.short_description: Elegantly simple corporate eCards
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Ekarda account](https://ekarda.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login |
| Audience | Audience URL |

You can find these values in the service provider metadata. Go to **Admin** > **My Account**, in the **SAML Settings** section you will find a link "Service Provider metadata", that will open the XML descriptor:

| Attribute | Value |
|-|-|
| Location | CallbackURL |
| entityID | Audience |

## Configure integration with Ekarda

To configure the integration with **Ekarda**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your Ekarda website and click on **Admin** > **My Account** from the top pane.
2. In the **SAML Settings** section at the bottom of the page you need to enter the following value.
    - **IDP Entity ID**: Issuer
    - **IDP Login URL**: Identity Provider Login URL
    - **IDP x509 Certificate**: Copy and paste the content of the Identity Provider Certificate
3. In the **Attribute Mapping** section enter the following values:
    - Email: email
    - Username: userName
    - First Name: firstName
    - Last Name: lastName
4. You can disable Ekarda login with **Force SAML** and Just-in-time provisioning with **CompanyId for JIT**
5. Click on **Update**

For more details, you can follow **Ekarda** [docs](https://support.ekarda.com/SSO-Implementation.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Ekarda. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Envoy
integrations.description:
Design a place where everyone can feel safe and productive with Envoy’s workplace platform—Protect, Visitors, Deliveries, Rooms, and Desks.

SSO with Auth0 allows for your users and customers to sign on with a single credential.
integrations.short_description: Integrate with Envoy, the enterprise-grade workplace platform
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an Premium or Enterprise Envoy account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Sign On URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://app.envoy.com/a/saml/consume`|

## Configure integration with Envoy

To configure the integration with Envoy, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. On the dashboard go to [Integrations](https://dashboard.envoy.com/integrations)
2. Find "SAML" and click "Install"
3. Add Auth0's fingerprint
4. In **Identity Provider HTTP SAML URL** enter the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
5. There you will also find the Sign On URL (Assertion Consumer Service URL)

For more details and to learn more about Envoy SSO integration go to [Envoy's SAML tutorial](https://envoy.help/en/articles/3450163-setting-up-saml)

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Envoy. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description:
Evernote Business brings your teams work together. Create documents, collaborate on projects, and store information all in one place. Teammates can access, edit, upload, and share notes and files from any device--even if theyre offline. Cut through the noise, and quickly find the information you need with powerful search capabilities and integrations with tools you already use. Unify your workflow with Evernote Business.

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Evernote Business.
integrations.short_description: Create visibility into projects, workflows, and deadlines
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Evernote Business account](https://evernote.com/business).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://www.evernote.com/SamlConsumer.action`|

## Configure integration with Evernote Business

To configure the integration with **Evernote Business**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Sign in to the [admin console](https://www.evernote.com/business/AccountSettings.action).
2. Click **Single Sign-On** from the navigation menu.
3. Enter the **SAML HTTP Request URL** with the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
4. Enter the **X.509 Certificate** from the **Identity Provider Certificate**.
5. Select a **Session Duration**.
6. Click **Save & Enable**

For more details, you can follow **Evernote Business** [docs](https://help.evernote.com/hc/en-us/articles/209005217-Configure-SSO-for-your-Evernote-Business-account).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Evernote Business. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Fastly
integrations.description: Fastly helps the world’s most popular digital businesses keep pace with their customer expectations by delivering fast, secure, and scalable online experiences. Businesses trust Fastly’s edge cloud platform to accelerate the pace of technical innovation, mitigate evolving threats, and scale on demand. Founded in 2011, Fastly powers online destinations including Airbnb, GitHub, Alaska Airlines, Pinterest, Vimeo, The Guardian, The New York Times, and Ticketmaster.
integrations.short_description: The edge cloud platform behind the best of the web
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Fastly account](https://www.fastly.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://manage.fastly.com/saml/consume`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://api.fastly.com/saml/{id}` |

## Configure integration with Fastly

To configure the integration with **Fastly**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Fastly.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Account** > **Single Sign On** 
3. Click on **Add SAML Configuration**
4. Choose the **Generic IdP** option.
5. Upload the Identity Provider Metadata file into the **IdP Metadata** field.
6. Press **Save and Enable SSO** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Fastly** [docs](https://docs.fastly.com/en/guides/setting-up-single-sign-on-sso).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Fastly. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Fivetran connectors deploy in minutes, require zero maintenance, and automatically adjust to source changes — so your data team can stop worrying about engineering and focus on driving insights.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Fivetran account](https://fivetran.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://fivetran.com/login/saml/return`|



## Configure integration with Fivetran

To configure the integration with **Fivetran**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Fivetran.
2. Click on **User Name Warehouse** > **Manage Account** > **Settings** 
3. Scroll to **SAML Config** and click on **Enable SAML**.
4. **Identity Provider URL**: Copy and paste the Identity Provider URL.
5. **SAML Issuer** Copy and paste the SAML Issuer.
6. **Public certificate**: Open the Identity Provider Certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it without **Start/End** tags.
7. Press **Save Config** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Fivetran** [docs](https://fivetran.com/docs/getting-started/account/azure-saml-sso).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Fivetran. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Delight your customers and win them for life. Freshdesk is an online cloud-based customer service software providing helpdesk support with all smart automations to get things done faster. With Freshdesk, you can streamline all your customer conversations in one place, automate your repetitive work and save time, collaborate with other teams to resolve issues faster, and much more.
integrations.short_description: SSO for Freshdesk's omnichannel, bots, and self-service solutions for customer service
integrations.install_guide:
The Freshdesk [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Freshdesk. Your users log in to Freshdesk with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Freshdesk account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Callback URLURL to which the user is redirected after login (https://{domain}.freshdesk.com/login/saml).
AudienceService Provider Entity ID from within Freshdesk (https://{domain}.freshworks.com/sp/SAML/{xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx}/metadata).
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Freshdesk To configure the integration with Freshdesk, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Freshdesk. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)
