integrations.name: Freshservice
integrations.description:
Freshservice is a cloud-based service desk and IT service management (ITSM) solution that currently serves more than 40000 SMB, mid-market, and enterprise customers worldwide. 

Freshservice is designed, using ITIL best practice, to help IT organizations to focus on what’s most important – exceptional service delivery and customer satisfaction. In addition to supporting their service desk and ITSM needs, these customers choose Freshservice based on ease to use, speed of setup, customer service, and affordability.

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Freshservice.
integrations.short_description: Intelligent, Right-Sized Service Management Solution for the Modern Enterprise
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Freshservice account](https://boomi.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.myfreshworks.com/sp/SAML/{account_id}/callback`|

* You will find the Callback URL (Assertion Consumer Service URL) later in Freshservice configurations.

## Configure integration with Freshservice

To configure the integration with **Freshservice**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log into your **Freshservice** as an administrator.
2. Go to **Admin** > **Helpdesk Security**. 
3. Click on the **SSO** toggle to enable it.
4. Click on **Edit SSO**. Here you can find the **ACS URL**.
4. Map the following values from the **Tutorial** view:
    - Entity ID provided by the IdP: Issuer
    - SAML SSO URL: Identity Provider Login URL
    - Security certificate: Copy the contents of Identity Provider Certificate
5. Select **Only Signed Assertions** in the **Signing Options**

For more details, you can follow **Freshservice** [docs](https://support.freshservice.com/support/solutions/articles/193635-single-sign-on-for-freshservice-using-saml).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Freshservice. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: GitHub Enterprise Cloud
integrations.description:
SAML SSO gives organization owners and enterprise owners on GitHub a way to control and secure access to organization resources like repositories, issues, and pull requests. Organization owners can invite your user account on GitHub to join their organization that uses SAML SSO, which allows you to contribute to the organization and retain your existing identity and contributions on GitHub.

When you access resources within an organization that uses SAML SSO, GitHub will redirect users Auth0 to authenticate. After you successfully authenticate with your account on Auth0, Auth0 redirects you back to GitHub, where you can access the organization's resources.
integrations.short_description: Organizations on GitHub Cloud can use SSO as an easy way to login with a shared credential
integrations.install_guide:

Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. integrations.name: Harness
integrations.description: Harness.io is a self-service platform solution for every team the Harness CI/CD Platform enables software changes of all types to reach production environments in a safe, quick, and sustainable way.
integrations.short_description: Empower engineers to deliver software on-demand with intelligent Software Delivery
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an Harness account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://app.harness.io/gateway/api/users/saml-login?accountId={accountId}`|

## Configure integration with Harness

To configure the integration with Harness, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to **Security > AccessManagement** and then select **Authentication Settings**
2. Click on **+ Add SSO Providers > SAML**
3. Set a name, upload your metadata file
4. On the **Group Attribute name** set `http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/claims/Group`
5. Save the changes

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Harness. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Helper Helpers remarkably efficient software platform and mobile apps enable you to easily coordinate and track service hours across your entire organization. When you implement our solution well provide a custom training for your team on how to effectively utilize Helper Helper in addition we are always available by phone and email to support you. We make it easy to increase your community impact while you track your community engagement.
integrations.short_description: The simplest way to coordinate & track service hours
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Helper Helper account](https://www.helperhelper.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://sso.helperhelper.com/saml/{id}/assert`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://sso.helperhelper.com/saml/{id}` |


## Configure integration with Helper Helper

To configure the integration with **Helper Helper**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Contact Helper Helper via email and send them your Identity Provider Metadata.
2. Helper Helper will send the Callback URL and Audience for the configuration form in Auth0.
3. Login to Helper Helper and they will redirect you to the SSO login.

For more details, you can follow **Helper Helper** [docs](https://www.helperhelper.com/how-it-works/singe-sign-on/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Helper Helper. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Heroku
integrations.description:
Heroku easily integrates with Auth0 to enable single sign-on (SSO) to Heroku using the same credentials and login experience as your other SSO-enabled service providers.

Using SSO, an employee logs in to Heroku using your identity provider’s interface instead of the Heroku login page. The employee’s browser is then redirected to Heroku, authenticated and ready to go. When SSO is enabled, Heroku’s own login mechanism is disabled, meaning that authentication security is shifted to Auth0 and coordinated with your other service providers.
integrations.short_description: Allow Heroku developers a secure, centralized way to log into Heroku from Auth0

It is a comprehensive platform that brings together several important functionalities under a single location that is easy to use, smart, and intuitively designed.
integrations.short_description: Plan, schedule, report and manage your entire team in one place
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Hub Planner account](https://hubplanner.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**.

## Configure integration with Hub Planner

To configure the integration with **Hub Planner**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Hub Planner.
2. Click on **Settings**.
3. Scroll and click on **Authentication**.
4. Click on **SSO (Single Sign-On)**.
5. Fill the **SAML 2.0 Endpoint URL (HTTP):** field with the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
6. Fill the **Identity Provider Issuer** field with the **IdP Issuer**.
7. Fill the **X.509 certificate** field with the **IdP Certificate** that can be found in the **IdP metadata file**.
8. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Hub Planner** [docs](https://hubplanner.com/kb/setting-up-okta-sso-single-sign-on-with-hub-planner/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Hub Planner. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [jamf Pro account](https://www.jamf.com/products/jamf-pro/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.jamfcloud.com/saml/SSO`|

## Configure integration with jamf Pro

To configure the integration with **jamf Pro**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to **Settings** ⚙️ -> **System Setting** -> **Single Sign-on**.
2. Click on Edit 🖉 and select **Enable Single Sign-On** Authentication checkbox.
3. Choose **Other** in the **Identity Provider** dropdown and enter a name (Auth0).
4. Leave **Entity ID** with the default value.
5. Choose **Metadata URL** or **Metadata File** from the Identity Provider Metadata Source dropdown and provide this values.
6. Configure the **Token Expiration** if you need.
7. On **User Mapping** you can configure the mappings between Auth0 and jamf. Leave **Identity Provider User Mapping** as it is and change **Jamf Pro User Mapping** to "Email".
8. **Allow users to bypass the Single Sign-On authentication** can be changed to disable or enable the jamf login.
9. Other options can be left unchanged.

For more details, you can follow **jamf Pro** [tutorial](https://docs.jamf.com/10.27.0/jamf-pro/administrator-guide/Single_Sign-On.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to jamf Pro. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Jenkins
integrations.description:
Jenkins is a self-contained, open source automation server which can be used to automate all sorts of tasks related to building, testing, and delivering or deploying software.

Jenkins can be installed through native system packages, Docker, or even run standalone by any machine with a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) installed.

Integration with Auth0 provides companies with centralised access management so you are in control over user access to Jenkins.
integrations.short_description: Build great things at any scale
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin, you'll need:

- A Jenkins installation. Install instructions can be found [here](https://www.jenkins.io/doc/book/installing/)
- A [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Sign On URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `http://{domain}/securityRealm/moSamlAuth`|

## Configure integration with Jenkins

To configure the integration with Jenkins, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

First you need to download and install the SSO plugin on your Jenkins.
1. Login to your Jenkins
2. Go to **Manage Jenkins** option from the left pane, and open **Manage Plugins** tab
3. Search for **SAML Single Sign On(SSO)** in the available tab
4. Download and install the plugin

Configuration
1. Open **Manage Jenkins**, **Configure Global Security**, and set the **Security Realm** as **miniOrange SAML 2.0**
2. You will find here the Sign On URL under **SP Configuration**
3. On **IDP Configuration** fill the required parameter with Auth0 information:
    - IDP Entity ID / Issuer
    - Single Sign On URL
    - IDP Signing Certificate
4. On **User Profile Configuration** set the user account settings

For more details and to learn more about Jenkins SSO integration go to [Jenkins's SAML tutorial](https://plugins.jenkins.io/miniorange-saml-sp/#documentation)

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Jenkins. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Jitbit Helpdesk
integrations.description:
Jitbit Helpdesk is a great support ticketing system, offered both as a SaaS and "on-premise" versions at a very reasonable price. Comes with a mobile app, powerful integrations, SAML- and windows-integrated authentication. Not to mention all the standard helpdesk feature, like Knowledge base, file attachments, email integration, live updates, agent collision detection, and all the rest

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access Jitbit Helpdesk.
integrations.short_description: Trusted by thousands of companies across 50+ countries
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Jitbit Helpdesk account](https://www.jitbit.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.jitbit.com/helpdesk/Saml/Consume`|

## Configure integration with Jitbit Helpdesk

To configure the integration with **Jitbit Helpdesk**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log into your **Jitbit Helpdesk** as an administrator.
2. In the top toolbar, click **Administration** and click in **General settings**.
3. Go to the **Authentication settings** section and select **Enable SAML 2.0 single sign on**.
4. Enter in the **EndPoint URL** input the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
5. In **x509 certificate** copy and paste the content of **Identity Provider Certificate**.
6. Click **Save changes**.

For more details, you can follow **Jitbit Helpdesk** [docs](https://www.jitbit.com/saas-helpdesk/single-sign-on/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Jitbit Helpdesk. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Jostle
integrations.description: Jostle is the only intranet designed to simplify life, and keep it simple as you grow--so your people and your organization can flourish. Why? Because today's workplaces are more fragmented than ever: people are dispersed, there's more info, and more ways to communicate than ever. Many tools promise to solve this, but they all eventually fail. They rely on an outdated design that makes them too noisy and finding information becomes a headache. We decided to fix this problem.
integrations.short_description: An employee intranet designed to help your culture thrive
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Jostle account](https://jostle.me/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://login-prod.jostle.us/saml/SSO/alias/newjostle.us`|


## Configure integration with Jostle

To configure the integration with **Jostle**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Contact via email with Jostle and send them your Identity Provider Metadata.
2. After confirmation login to your Jostle account.
3. Click on **Admin Settings** > **Edit,Re-invite, Disable Users**
4. Search User you want to enable SSO.
5. On the **Login Authentication Method** section select **Single Sign On (SSO) Credentials**
6. Press **Save changes** to save the settings.
7. User will receive an email of confirmation.

For more details, you can follow **Jostle** [docs](https://forum.jostle.us/hc/en-us/articles/208405666-Single-Sign-On-SSO-overview).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Jostle. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Using clicks instead of code, Kintone users can build apps that automate business processes, collaborate on projects/tasks, and quickly report on complex data.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Kintone account](https://www.kintone.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.kintone.com/saml/acs`|

## Configure integration with Kintone

To configure the integration with **Kintone**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Kintone.
2. Click on **Administration** 
3. Under **Security** click on **Login**.
3. Enable **SAML Authentication**
4. Enter the Identity Provider Login Url in the **Login Url** section
5. Enter a Url where you wish to be redirected after logout in the **Logout Url**: section
6. Download and upload the Identity Provider Certificate in **Certificate** section.
7. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Kintone** [docs](https://jp.cybozu.help/general/en/admin/list_externalservices/list_saml/saml_settings.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Kintone. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Klipfolio account](https://www.klipfolio.com).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. | Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://app.klipfolio.com/SAML/consume`|

## Configure integration with Klipfolio

To configure the integration with **Klipfolio**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Klipfolio.
2. Click on **Your User Name** > **Settings** 
3. Click on **Settings** tab and click on **Single Sign-On**.
3. Click on **Edit**
4. Choose **SAML2** option.
5. Download the certificate from Auth0.
6. Open and Copy omitting the **BEGIN** and **End** lines.
7. Paste the certificate into the **Certificate** section.
8. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Klipfolio** [docs](https://support.klipfolio.com/hc/en-us/articles/215634338-Klips-Implementing-single-sign-on).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Klipfolio. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: KnowBe4 is the world’s largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform that helps you manage the ongoing problem of social engineering. The KnowBe4 platform is user-friendly and intuitive. It was built to scale for busy IT pros that have 16 other fires to put out. Our goal was to design the most powerful, yet easy-to-use platform available.
integrations.short_description: Security awareness training and simulated phishing platform.
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [KnowBe4 account](https://www.knowbe4.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://training.knowbe4.com/auth/saml/{id}/callback`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://{unique_code}.knowbe4.com`, this URL generated in the Service Provider SAML/SSO settings.  |


## Configure integration with KnowBe4

To configure the integration with **KnowBe4**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to KnowBe4.
2. Click on **User email** > **Account Settings**. 
3. Click on **Account Integrations** and click on **SAML**.
4. Click on **SAML Settings**.
5. Click on **Enable SAML SSO** to enable the service.
6. Enter **Identity Provider Login URL** into the **IdP SSO Target URL** field.
7. Enter **Identity Provider SHA1 fingerprint** into the **IdP Cert Fingerprint** field.
8. Click on **Generate Unique Entity ID** to generate the **Audience URL**.
8. Press **Save SAML Settings** then press **Save Changes** at the bottom of the page to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **KnowBe4** [docs](https://support.knowbe4.com/hc/en-us/articles/115013730808).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to KnowBe4. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [LeanKit account](https://www.planview.com/products-solutions/products/leankit/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.leankit.com/Account/Membership/ExternalLogin`|

## Configure integration with LeanKit

To configure the integration with **LeanKit**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Contact LeanKit via email and send them your the follow information:
        -Identity Provider Certificate
        -Identity Provider URL
2. LeanKit will send an email with confirmation that the SSO is enabled. 
3. Login to LeanKit and they will redirect you to the SSO login.

For more details, you can follow **LeanKit** [docs](https://success.planview.com/Planview_LeanKit/Account/User_Administration/Enable_Single-Sign-On_(SSO)).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to LeanKit. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description:
Auth0 SSO allows your users to quickly access SAP Litmos with a single credential that you manage. SAP Litmos is an online corporate training platform that enables smarter, faster corporate eLearning. The solution is comprised of a powerful learning management system (LMS), SAP Litmos Training, and a content-rich training course catalog, SAP Litmos Training Content. It’s the ideal combination to improve L D and HR training programs by automating tasks from course creation to assignment to tracking and reporting and beyond.

For L&D and HR professionals, the platform makes it easier to manage the entire learning program from system implementation and integration to ongoing administration. Plus, adding new courses is a breeze with access to built-in, off-the-shelf learning content. For learners, the LMS streamlines how users interact with courses and content, providing instant access to ongoing training, whether they’re employees, customers, or members of the extended enterprise (partners, contractors, suppliers, etc.).

Lucidchart is the intelligent diagramming application that brings teams together to make better decisions and build the future. SSO with Auth0 allows for your users to sign in to Lucidchart with a single credential and quickly get to work.

Clarify complexity – Individuals and teams can easily and quickly map out where they are, what’s missing, and what’s next.

integrations.short_description: Lucidchart is the intelligent diagramming application.
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Lucidchart account](https://www.lucidchart.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://www.lucidchart.com/saml/sso/{domain}`|


## Configure integration with Lucidchart

To configure the integration with **Lucidchart**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Lucidchart.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Account Settings**.
3. Click on **ADMIN**.
4. Click on **Identity Management**.
5. Click on **Allow SAML authentication** to enable SAML authentication.
6. Click on **Configure**.
7. In the **Lucidchart Sign in URL** section define the **Domain** field or modify it if required. This value is used in the **domain** value in the **Callback URL**.
8. In the **Identity Providers** section click on **Add Identity Provider** and upload the **IdP** metadata file.
9. The settings are saved automatically, you can test it pressing on **Test SAML Connection** button.

For more details, you can follow **Lucidchart** [docs](https://lucidco.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360049898191-SAML-Overview).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Lucidchart. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Mapbox account](https://www.mapbox.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://api.mapbox.com/api/sso/saml`|


## Configure integration with Mapbox

To configure the integration with **Mapbox**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Mapbox.
2. Click on **Settings** > **Security** 
3. Scroll to **Single Sign On** and click **On**.
4. **IdP sign-on URL**: Copy and paste the Identity Provider URL.
5. **Issuer ID** Copy and paste the SAML Issuer.
6. **X.509 certificate**: Open the Identity Provider Certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it.
7. Press **Save single sign on settings** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Mapbox** [docs](https://docs.mapbox.com/accounts/guides/settings/#identity-providers-that-support-saml-2.0).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Mapbox. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: MongoDB Cloud
integrations.description:
The core of MongoDB Cloud is MongoDB Atlas, a fully managed cloud database for modern applications. Atlas is the best way to run MongoDB, the leading modern database. MongoDB’s document model is the fastest way to innovate, bringing flexibility and ease of use to the database.

MongoDB Atlas is the global cloud database service for modern applications. Deploy fully managed MongoDB across AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure with best-in-class automation and proven practices that guarantee availability, scalability, and compliance with the most demanding data security and privacy standards.
integrations.short_description: MongoDB Cloud is the best way to build data-driven applications
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [MongoDB Cloud account](https://www.mongodb.com/cloud).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login|
| Audience | Audience URI (Service Provider Entity ID)|

You can locate the proper URLs after you configure the **Identity Provider** in MongoDB Cloud.

## Configure integration with MongoDB Cloud

To configure the integration with **MongoDB Cloud**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to MongoDB Cloud.
2. In the upper left corner you will find the **Organization** dropdown, select your organization and click on **Settings**.
3. Click on **Manage Federation Settings** -> **Visit Federation Management App**.
4. Click on **Manage Identity Providers** and **Setup Identity Provider**.
5. Enter the following configurations:
    - Configuration Name: Auth0
    - Single Sign-On URL: The IdP Login URL
    - Issuer URI: Issuer
    - Upload the IdP certificate on **Identity Provider Signature Certificate**
    - Request Binding: HTTP POST
    - Response Signature Algorithm: SHA-1
6. Click Next.
7. In the last page you have the **Assertion Consumer Service URL** (Callback URL) and the **Audience URI**. You have to copy this URLs to configure Auth0 side.
8. Click Finish.

Notes:

Once you configure the Identity Provider, it shows as `Inactive` in the Federation Management Console until you [map at least one domain](https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/security/manage-domain-mapping/#std-label-atlas-manage-fed-domain-map) to the IdP.

For more details, you can follow **MongoDB Cloud** [docs](https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/security/manage-federated-auth/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to MongoDB Cloud. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an Nuclino account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. |-|-|

3. Select **SAML-based single sign-on (SSO)**

6. Click on **Save Changes**

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Nuclino. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

The Auth0 Microsoft 365 Single Sign-on (SSO) Integration lets you create a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities. Single sign-on provides with Microsoft 365 is a giant leap forward in how users sign in and use applications. Your users can use the same O365 email address and password (credentials) to access your MyHub site so they no longer need to remember another password.

Microsoft 365 single sign-on (SSO) adds security and convenience when your users sign on to applications with Auth0. With single sign-on, users sign in once with one account to access domain-joined devices, company resources, software as a service (SaaS) applications, and web applications.
integrations.short_description: With Microsoft 365 SSO and Auth0, users sign in once to access Microsoft supported clients

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| **Setting** | **Description** |
|-------------|-----------------|
| Domain      | Your Office 365 domain. Format: <your-office365-domain>.com. |
| Auth0 Connection | Connection you have configured in Auth0. In most cases, you will use an Active Directory connection. You can also configure a Database connection, but only for testing an already-configured Office 365 tenant. If you are doing [custom provisioning](https://auth0.com/docs/integrations/office-365-custom-provisioning), select additional connections in the Connections view. |

![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Office 365

To configure the integration with Office 365, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Office 365. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

install_guide_json.content: The Office 365 Single Sign-on (SSO) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Office 365. Your users log in to Office 365 with Auth0 identity providers, which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • Sign up for an Office 365 account.
  • Set up a connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

Setting Description
Domain Your Office 365 domain. Format: .com.
Auth0 Connection Connection you have configured in Auth0. In most cases, you will use an Active Directory connection. You can also configure a Database connection, but only for testing an already-configured Office 365 tenant. If you are doing custom provisioning, select additional connections in the Connections view.

Configure integration with Office 365

To configure the integration with Office 365, follow the instructions listed in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Office 365. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view.
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [onDMARC account](https://ondmarc.redshift.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://sso.redsift.cloud/organizations/ondmarc/saml`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `http://app.ondmarc.com` |


## Configure integration with onDMARC

To configure the integration with **onDMARC**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to onDMARC.
2. Download the metadata file from Identity Provider Metadata
3. Contact the onDMARC support team from your account and send them metadata file
4. Wait for confirmation
For more details, you can follow **onDMARC** [docs](https://knowledge.ondmarc.redsift.com/en/articles/945131-does-ondmarc-support-saml-sso).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to onDMARC. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description:
OneDesk combines online HelpDesk and Project Management software. Serve your customers and manage team projects with one application.

OneDesk helpdesk software platform – support your customers with flexible ticket workflows, email, live chat, web-forms, ticket portal, and other tools.
integrations.short_description: Manage your projects, support your customers, provide services.
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [OneDesk account](https://www.onedesk.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://app.onedesk.com/sso/saml/SSO/alias/onedesk.com_{company_name}`|
| Audience | Your target audience `onedesk.com_{company_name}`|

`company_name` is your company name in lowercase. Ex: `My Company` -> `mycompany`. You can also find this value in the following steps.

## Configure integration with OneDesk

To configure the integration with **OneDesk**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your OneDesk website and click to **Administration** (the gear icon) > **Integrations** > **Single Sing On**.
2. Click **Enable SSO for users** and select **SAML** and expand the panel.
3. Here you can provide the Auth0 metadata to configure OneDesk. Download the **Identity Provider Metadata** file from **Tutorial** view.
4. Select **Upload Metadata File** and upload the previous file.
5. The **OneDesk SSO Login URL** link shows. This link is the **Callback URL** from the previous step.
6. Click on **Advanced Settings**. Here you have to map the user attributes from Auth0. For that click on the dropdown and add the choice manually.
    
    |Dropdown Name|Attribute Name|
    |-|-|
    |Email Attribute|email|
    |First Name Attribute|firstName|
    |Last Name Attribute|lastName|
7. Setting are saved automatically.

For more details, you can follow **OneDesk** [docs](https://www.onedesk.com/es/single-sign-on-sso-for-your-users-in-onedesk/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to OneDesk. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Orginio account](https://orginio.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.orginio.com/api/auth/getToken/ui`|


## Configure integration with Orginio

To configure the integration with **Orginio**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Orginio.
2. Click on **Settings** 
3. Click on **User Management** > **SSO** > **Change Provider**.
4. Choose **SAML 2.0** from the dropdown options.
5. **STS SAML 2.0 Endpoints URL**: Copy and paste the Identity Provider URL.
6. **STS / IdP Signing Certificate**: Open the Identity Provider Certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it.
7. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Orginio** [docs](https://saml-doc.okta.com/SAML_Docs/How-to-Configure-SAML-2.0-for-Orginio.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Orginio. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description:
PagerDuty is the central nervous system for your digital ecosystem.

An always-on world requires a proactive and preventative approach to managing your digital operations. PagerDuty gives you real-time visibility into your critical apps and services all in one place, driven by our full-service ownership model.

### Why PagerDuty?
Whether it’s keeping the eggs fresh or keeping the website running, over 12,000 customers choose PagerDuty. Here’s why:
- Easy to start, easy to grow
- Most reliable and scalable
- Fastest resolution
- Continual Improvement
integrations.short_description: Connect securely to PagerDuty, the real-time operations platform
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an PagerDuty account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | SAML Endpoint URL from PagerDuty like `https://{domain}.pagerduty.com/sso/saml/consume`|
| Audience | The audience follows this format `https://{domain}.pagerduty.com` |

## Configure integration with PagerDuty

To configure the integration with PagerDuty, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Click your user icon on the right and select Account Settings and select the Single Sign-on tab.
2. Click the SAML radio button to configure Single Sign On in PagerDuty
3. Copy the SAML Endpoint URL to paste into Auth0
4. Paste the certificate in the X.509 Certificate field and paste the Login URL
5. Save changes

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to PagerDuty. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: People HR
integrations.description:
Designed for small to mid-sized businesses, PeopleHR provides a platform for all key HR functions, including applicant tracking, personnel tracking, performance review, and more. The system includes an employee-tracking database, that allows users to create new employee records, fill in key contact information, and store documents. PeopleHR includes unlimited document storage, so users can attach as much paperwork as necessary to each employee profile.

Within the applicant tracking module of PeopleHR, users can create new job offerings, as well as build out a custom career page that matches the branding of a company’s site. Each job posting can be completely customized. Once a candidate applies, they’re added to the recruitment pipeline, and recruiters can view all candidate information.
integrations.short_description: HR software that really matters
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [People HR account](https://www.peoplehr.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. | Setting | Description |
|-|-|

## Configure integration with People HR

To configure the integration with **People HR**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to **People HR** with an administrator account.
2. Navigate to **Settings** > **Company**.
3. Scroll and find the **Upload 'Single Sign On' SAML meta-data file** file uploader.
4. Click **Browse** and select the metadata file from Auth0.

## Enable connections

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Phrase account](https://phrase.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://sso.phrase.com/account/auth/saml/callback?id={id}`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://app.phrase.com/accounts/{domain}/{id}` |


## Configure integration with Phrase

To configure the integration with **Phrase**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Phrase.
2. Click on **User Name** > **SSO** 
3. Click on **Enable**
4. Enter the Identity Provider Login URL on **Single Sign-On URL**
5. Enter the Issuer on **Issuer**
6. Copy and paste the x.509 certificate provided by Auth0.
7. Enter the Identity Provider SHA1 fingerprint on **Certificate Fingerprint**
8. Select SHA1 on **Fingerprint Algorithm**
9. Press **Update Settings** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Phrase** [docs](https://help.phrase.com/help/single-sign-on-sso/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Phrase. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Audience Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like https://app.phrase.com/accounts/{domain}/{id}

Configure integration with Phrase

To configure the integration with Phrase, follow the steps below with the data shown in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

  1. Log in to Phrase.
  2. Click on User Name > SSO
  3. Click on Enable
  4. Enter the Identity Provider Login URL on Single Sign-On URL
  5. Enter the Issuer on Issuer
  6. Copy and paste the x.509 certificate provided by Auth0.
  7. Enter the Identity Provider SHA1 fingerprint on Certificate Fingerprint
  8. Select SHA1 on Fingerprint Algorithm
  9. Press Update Settings to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow Phrase docs.

Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Phrase. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Pingboard
integrations.description: Pingboard changes the way organizations plan for their most important asset, their people. Pingboard offers a variety of different products including a fully customizable org chart, easy to use company directories, and helpful onboarding tools that helps you become more transparent, leading to more efficient, and better-working teams. With Pingboard you can create unlimited, private copies of your plan to ensure you are prepared for every scenario.
integrations.short_description: Power Up Your Employee Network
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Pingboard account](https://pingboard.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.pingboard.com/auth/saml/consume`|

## Configure integration with Pingboard

To configure the integration with **Pingboard**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Pingboard.
2. Click on **Admin** > **Add-Ons** > **Custom SSO** 
3. Click on **Enable**
4. Copy and Paste the Identity Provider Metadata file into the **IdP Metadata** field.
5. Choose **urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress** for **Name ID Format**
6. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Pingboard** [docs](https://support.pingboard.com/hc/en-us/articles/360046585994-Set-Up-a-Custom-SSO-Solution?mobile_site=false).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Pingboard. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Pluralsight
integrations.description:
Pluralsight easily integrates with Auth0 to enable single sign-on (SSO) to Pluralsight using the same credentials and login experience as your other SSO-enabled service providers.

Using SSO, an employee logs in to Pluralsight using your identity provider’s interface instead of the Pluralsight login page. The employee’s browser is then redirected to Pluralsight, authenticated and ready to go. When SSO is enabled, Pluralsight’s own login mechanism is disabled, meaning that authentication security is shifted to Auth0 and coordinated with your other service providers.
integrations.short_description: SSO provides Pluralsight developers a secure, centralized way to log into Pluralsight from Auth0
integrations.install_guide:
The Pluralsight [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Pluralsight. Your users log in to Pluralsight with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

*   Sign up for a Pluralsight account.
*   [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, and click **Save**. ![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png)

## Configure integration with Pluralsight

To configure the integration with Pluralsight, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Pluralsight. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1.  Select the **Connections** view.
    
2.  Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

- Sign up for an [PolicyTech account](https://www.navexglobal.com/en-us/products/policytech-policy-procedure-management-software).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. | Setting | Description |

Unlike traditional setups where businesses implement multiple systems and platforms to get the job done, Productive.io provides users with a single solution to manage their business, enhance collaboration and communication, and drive business growth.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Productive account](https://www.productive.io/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://api.productive.io/api/v2/sessions/consume_single_sign_on?account_id={account_id}&app=https://app.productive.io/public/sso`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://api.productive.io` |


## Configure integration with Productive

To configure the integration with **Productive**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Productive.
2. Click on **Home** > **Settings** 
3. Scroll and click on **Single Sign-on** and click on **Configure**.
4. Fill the **IDENTITY PROVIDER SINGLE SIGN-ON URL** field with the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
5. Fill the **METADATA URL** field.
6. Press **ENABLE SSO** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Productive** [docs](https://help.productive.io/en/articles/4362408-single-sign-on-sso).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Productive. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [PurelyHr account](https://www.purelyhr.com/software/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.purelyhr.com/sso-consume` |
| Audience | The PurelyHR domain `https://{domain}.purelyhr.com`|

## Configure integration with PurelyHR

To configure the integration with **PurelyHR**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your PurelyHR dashboard `https://{domain}.purelyhr.com/dashboard` and click on **SSO SETTINGS**.
2. On **Connector** select **Generic SAML**.
3. Copy and paste the x.509 certificate provided by Auth0.
4. Enter the Issuer on **IdP Issuer Url**
5. Enter the Identity Provider Login URL on **IdP Endpoint Url**
6. You can enable **Force SSO** to disable PurelyHR login.
7. You can enable **Auto-Create Users** create new users on SSO.
8. Click on **Save Changes**.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to PurelyHR. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Quickbase account](https://www.quickbase.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://{domain}.quickbase.com/saml/SSOAssert.aspx`|


## Configure integration with Quickbase

To configure the integration with **Quickbase**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Quickbase.
2. Click on **Quickbase Admin** > **Manage the realm**.
3. Click on **SAML Authentication** then click on **Configure SAML**.
4. In **Certificate file (.cert)** click on **Choose file** and upload the certificate file.
5. Fill the **Sign-in URL** field with the **Identity Provider Login URL**.
6. Fill the **Support page URL** field with the URL for internal IT support and provide a text in **Text for support link**.
7. Set the **Entity ID** field with an URL of the form `https://{domain}.quickbase.com`.
8. Fill the **Provider name** field.
9. Press **Submit** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Quickbase** [docs](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/realm_saml.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Quickbase. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://app-auth-api.roadmunk.com/auth/saml/callback`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `ttps://app-auth-api.roadmunk.com/auth/saml/metadata/sp/{id}` |


## Configure integration with Roadmunk

To configure the integration with **Roadmunk**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Roadmunk.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Account Settings**.
3. Scroll and click on **Single Sign On**.
4. Upload the Identity Provider Metadata file into the **Identity Provider Metadata** field.
5. Press **Save** to save the settings.
6. Go to the **Security** tab.
7. Click on **Login method** button and select **SSO**.

For more details, you can follow **Roadmunk** [docs](https://support.roadmunk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042149514-Alternate-Authentication-Methods-in-Roadmunk).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Roadmunk. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Salesforce Single Sign On
integrations.description: With single sign-on (SSO) and Auth0, users quickly access authorized Salesforce network resources with one login. Usernames and passwords are validated through Auth0 against your corporate user database rather than Salesforce managing separate passwords for each resource. SSO is available in both Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience.
integrations.short_description: Salesforce single sign-on with Auth0 lets users access your resources with one login
integrations.install_guide:
The Salesforce [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Salesforce. Your users log in to Salesforce with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Salesforce account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Salesforce DomainYour Salesforce Domain.
Entity IDArbitrary URL that identifies the Salesforce resource.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Salesforce.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Salesforce To configure the integration with Salesforce, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Salesforce. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.name: Sauce Labs
integrations.description: This app integration supports Single Sign-On and automatic account provisioning for Sauce Labs.
integrations.short_description: Single Sign-On and accounts provisioning for Sauce Labs
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

1. An Auth0 account and tenant. [Sign up for free](https://auth0.com/signup).
2. A Sauce Labs account and active enterprise plan:

* Create a freemium account at [Sauce Labs](https://saucelabs.com/sign-up).
* [Contact sales](https://saucelabs.com/sales) for custom enterprise plan.

## Configure SAML SSO on Auth0

1. Go to [Dashboard > Applications > Applications](https://manage.auth0.com/#/applications) and create a new application. Give it a meaningful name like **Sauce Labs**. You can choose any application type, but the **Regular Web App** type is recommended.
2. Go to the **Addons** tab and enable the **SAML2 Web App** toggle.
3. On the **Settings** tab, set the **Application Callback URL** to: `https://accounts.saucelabs.com/am/AuthConsumer/metaAlias/authtree/sp`
4. Paste the following code into the **Settings** text box and click **Debug**.

```json
{
  "audience": "https://accounts.saucelabs.com/sp",
  "recipient": "https://accounts.saucelabs.com/am/AuthConsumer/metaAlias/authtree/sp",
  "destination": "https://accounts.saucelabs.com/am/AuthConsumer/metaAlias/authtree/sp",
  "signResponse": true,
  "nameIdentifierFormat": "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress",
  "nameIdentifierProbes": ["http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress"],
  "binding": "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST",
  "mappings": {
    "first_name": "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname",
    "last_name": "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname"
  }
}
```

6. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click **Enable**.
7. On the **Usage** tab, locate **Identity Provider Metadata**, and click **Download** to download the metadata file. You'll need this when you [configure Auth0 as the identity provider on Sauce Labs](#set-up-saml-sso-on-sauce-labs).

If you have troubles configuring SAML parameters, please refer to the [Sauce Labs documentation on setting up SAML SSO](https://docs.saucelabs.com/basics/sso/setting-up-sso/#setting-up-identity-provider).

## Set up SAML SSO on Sauce Labs

To configure the integration with Sauce Labs, follow the steps from the [Sauce Labs documentation on SAML SSO](https://docs.saucelabs.com/basics/sso/setting-up-sso/#integrating-with-sauce-labs-service-provider).

integrations.name: ScreenSteps
integrations.description:
ScreenSteps provides a wide range of features designed to modernize your knowledge base and take it to the next level. Never put a caller on hold again — saving time, reducing employee mistakes, and making your whole organization run more efficiently.

- Call flows
- Context-sensitive help (for employees)
- Procedures
- Online searchable knowledge base
- Courses
- Troubleshooting guides

With Auth0 you can use SAML to enable Single-Sign On (SSO) and allow your users to log in once and use the same credentials to access ScreenSteps.
integrations.short_description: The knowledge base software that reduces employee mistakes, questions, and onboarding time
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an ScreenSteps account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | SAML Consumer URL from ScreenSteps SAML settings page like `https://{domain}.screenstepslive.com/saml/consume/{id}`|

## Configure integration with ScreenSteps

To configure the integration with ScreenSteps, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. On the left side menu go to **Settings**
2. Click on **Single Sign-on**
3. Click on **Configure SSO**
4. Set title and keep mode as **SAML**
5. Upload the **SAML Certificate** and **SAML Metadata**
6. Activate it and and fill in the **Remote Login URL**
7. Update the settings

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to ScreenSteps. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an ShareFile account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL from the ShareFile site like `https://{domain}.sharefile.com/saml/acs`|
| Audience | ShareFile Issuer from the ShareFile site like `https://{domain}.sharefile.com`|

## Configure integration with ShareFile

To configure the integration with ShareFile, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. On the main menu go to **Settings > Admin Settings**
2. Then go to **Security > Login & Security Policy**
3. In the **Single sign-on / SAML 2.0 Configuration** sections enable SAML and fill in your Auth0 installation details
4. Make sure to set **ShareFile Issuer / Entity ID:** like `{domain}.sharefile.com`
5. Click on **Save**

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to ShareFile. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.
