integrations.name: Shutterstock
integrations.description: Shutterstock is a leading global technology company offering a creative platform for high-quality content, tools and services to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. Our SSO helps streamline access to Shutterstock content to improve creative efficiency and ensures secure access with little IT overhead.
integrations.short_description: Shutterstock login via Auth0
integrations.install_guide:
Shutterstock provides single sign-on functionality to Auth0 customers through our Federated Identity connector.

## Contact Shutterstock

Setting up an SSO SAML integration with Shutterstock is straightforward. Contact the ​Shutterstock premier integrations group​ at [premierintegrations@shutterstock.com](mailto:premierintegrations@shutterstock.com) and provide them with the following information:

*   Your business/company name
*   A list of any email domains you own

Shutterstock will provide you with a Login Callback URL that looks something like:

`https://accounts.shutterstock.com/saml/113fcd1a-0fe9-11eb-adc1-0242ac120002/callback`

## Add the Auth0 SSO Integration

1.  Click the **Add Integration** button at the top
2.  Select the tenant to use to enable this integration, then **Continue**

## Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration

1.  Enter a name for the integration
2.  Paste the Login Callback URL provided by Shutterstock
3.  Click **Save**
4.  Leave the screen open on the **Tutorial** tab

## Provide SAML Metadata

You will need to provide Shutterstock the SAML metadata file for your newly configured Application. Contact the ​Shutterstock premier integrations group​ at [premierintegrations@shutterstock.com](mailto:premierintegrations@shutterstock.com) again and provide them with the URL in the **Identity Provider Metadata** field from above.

## Finalization

We will complete setup on our end with the configuration information you have given us and confirm with you when this is complete.

Because Shutterstock supports on-demand account provisioning, your users do not have to have a pre-existing Shutterstock account in order to use our single sign on with SAML functionality. We will create an account for your users if they do not already have one.

### Required SAML Assertion Attributes

In order to perform account provisioning and to ensure your users can sign in successfully, you will need to configure your Auth0 Application to pass us the following attributes as part of their SAML assertion:

*   `email`​ - a valid email for the authenticating user
*   `id`​ - a system unique identifier for the authenticating user
*   `name​` - a string representing the authenticating user's full formatted name: ​`{First} {Last}​`

## Technical Notes

Shutterstock's SAML offering is SAML 2.0 compliant and features on-demand account provisioning and assignment.

### RelayState

You have the option of specifying a relay state as part of the SAML configuration process. If you set the relay state, we will honor it and redirect authenticated users to the specified value after a successful authentication.

### Provisioning for pre-existing users

Shutterstock allows existing users to be associated with a third party identity management system. We use the ​email​specified in the required attributes of the SAML assertion in order to link an authenticating user to their existing Shutterstock account.

Contact Shutterstock

Setting up an SSO SAML integration with Shutterstock is straightforward. Contact the ​Shutterstock premier integrations group​ at premierintegrations@shutterstock.com and provide them with the following information:

  • Your business/company name
  • A list of any email domains you own

Shutterstock will provide you with a Login Callback URL that looks something like:

https://accounts.shutterstock.com/saml/113fcd1a-0fe9-11eb-adc1-0242ac120002/callback

  2. Select the tenant to use to enable this integration, then Continue

Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration

Because Shutterstock supports on-demand account provisioning, your users do not have to have a pre-existing Shutterstock account in order to use our single sign on with SAML functionality. We will create an account for your users if they do not already have one.

integrations.name: Sketchboard
integrations.description: Sketchboard is an infinite online white board, powered by your teams ideas. Use diagrams, notes, images and screenshots to brainstorm ideas. Tailored for Software Development. Sketchboard makes online diagramming simple, fun and intuitive.
integrations.short_description: Sketchboard makes online diagramming simple, fun and intuitive
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Sketchboard account](https://sketchboard.io/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://sketchboard.me/pub/api/v2/sso/saml/smlc_{id}`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `{id_code}` |


## Configure integration with Sketchboard

To configure the integration with **Sketchboard**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Sketchboard.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Security**.
3. Click on **Configure SSO**.
4. Click on **Enable SSO/SAML** to enable the SSO configuration.
5. In the **Identity Provider** section fill the **Issuer** field.
6. Fill the **SAML Sign-in URL** field.
7. Fill the **x509 Certificate** field.
8. Click **Save** to save the changes.
9. In **Security** in your account settings, change the **Log in type** in case SSO is not selected.

For more details, you can follow **Sketchboard** [docs](https://sketchboard.io/help/sso).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Sketchboard. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Slack Single Sign On
integrations.description:
Slack is where work happens

With channels in Slack, you and your team know where to go to ask questions, share updates and stay in the loop. Integrating Auth0 with your Slack SSO allows your users to quickly and securely sign onto Slack and start collaborating.
integrations.short_description: Give users quick low effort access to Slack through Auth0
integrations.install_guide:
The Slack [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Slack. Your users log in to Slack with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Slack account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Team NameName of your Slack team.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Slack.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Slack To configure the integration with Slack, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Slack. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Slemma account](https://slemma.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. 1. Log in to Slemma.
2. Click on **Admin** > **White label**.
3. Scroll down to **SSO settings**.
4. Click on **Enable Single Sign On (SAML 2.0)** to enable SSO.
5. Fill the **SAML sign-in URL** field with the Identity Provider Login URL.
6. Enter the **X.509 Certificate** from the Identity Provider Certificate contents.
7. Enter the **Acceptable domains** separated by a semicolon.
8. Press **SAVE CHANGES** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Slemma** [docs](https://support.slemma.com/knowledge_base/topics/saml-based-single-sign-on/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Slemma. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Solarwinds AppOptics is an extensible application performance management (APM) and metrics platform that grows with your team. It's a zero-configuration APM with distributed tracing, host and IT infrastructure monitoring with dozens of integrations, and custom metrics that all feed into the same dashboarding, analytics, and alerting pipelines.
integrations.short_description: An extensible application performance management
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [SolarWinds AppOptics account](https://www.solarwinds.com/appoptics)
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://my.solarwinds.cloud/auth/{id}/saml`|

## Configure integration with SSO_PROVIDER

To configure the integration with SSO_PROVIDER, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to **SolarWinds AppOptic** with an administrator account.
2. Navigate to **Settings** > **Organization Settings** > **Security**.
3. **Issuer (Entity ID)**: Copy and paste the Identity Provider URL.
4. **SAML URL**: Copy the Login URL.
5. **X.509 Certificate**: Open the Identity Provider Certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it.
6. Click **Save**
7. Click **Enable SAML Integration** and click **OK**

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Solarwinds AppOptics. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

    - SAML Issuer
    - Paste the x.509 IdP Certificate
4. You can enable the checkbox to create users if they do not exist and disable the **Service Desk** default login.

For more details, you can follow **SolarWind Service Desk** [docs](https://documentation.solarwinds.com/en/success_center/swsd/content/completeguidetoswsd/single%20sign%20on%20sso.htm).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to SolarWind Service Desk. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: SonarQube
integrations.description: SonarQube® is an automatic code review tool to detect bugs, vulnerabilities, and code smells in your code. It can integrate with your existing workflow to enable continuous code inspection across your project branches and pull requests.
integrations.short_description: Your teammate for Code Quality and Code Security
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Download and install [SonarQube](https://www.sonarqube.org/downloads/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}/oauth2/callback/saml`|

## Configure integration with SonarQube

To configure the integration with **SonarQube**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Sing in to your SonarQube with and admin account.
2. Go to **Administration** > **Configuration** > **General Settings** > **Security** > **SAML**.
3. Set **Enabled** to true.
4. Enter an **Application ID** or leave the default value (sonarqube).
5. Enter a **Provider Name** to show in your SonarQube login page.
6. In **Provider ID** enter the **Issuer**.
7. Enter in **SAML login url** the **Login URL**.
8. In **Provider certificate** paste the x.509 certificate.
9. In **login** and **name** SAML attributes enter `name`.
10. Save all the values.

For more details, you can follow **SonarQube** [docs](https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/instance-administration/delegated-auth/), SAML section.

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to SonarQube. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: SpringCM
integrations.description: A top rated Contract and Document Management service. SpringCM's cloud based product integrates with CRM systems like Salesforce or can be used standalone. SpringCM is a secure cloud platform that manages sales contracts and all types of documents across desktop, mobile and partner applications like Salesforce. SpringCM manages the entire contract life-cycle with advanced workflows that automate manual tasks and complex processes. Auth0 SSO allows your sales team to quickly connect to SpringCM saving time by only needing to remember a single credential and remain focused on customer success.
integrations.short_description: SSO allows users to quickly log into SpringCM with a single set of credentials
integrations.install_guide:
The SpringCM [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for SpringCM. Your users log in to SpringCM with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a SpringCM account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
SpringCM ACS URLACS URL for your SpringCM.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of SpringCM.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with SpringCM To configure the integration with SpringCM, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to SpringCM. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

5. Press **Update** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Statushub** [docs](https://support.statushub.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001826525-Setting-up-SAML-2-0-on-your-StatusHub).

## Enable connections

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description:
Sumo Logic knows cloud operations and analytics.

Our cloud-native, multi-tenant platform helps you make data-driven decisions and reduces your time to investigate security and operational issues. Here is how:

- Collect & centralize
More than 150 applications and integrations make it easy to aggregate data across your stack and down your pipeline.

- Search & investigate
Real-time analytics help you rapidly identify and resolve potential cyber attacks, detect and prevent breaches, and reduce compliance costs.

- Monitor & visualize
Customizable dashboards align teams by visualizing logs, metrics and performance data for full-stack visibility and reliable delivery.

- Alert & notify
Machine-learning algorithms work 24/7 and alert you if there’s an important event or problem to fix.

integrations.name: Tableau Online
integrations.description:
Allow your Tableau Online users a quick method to login securely to your data and dashboards. Harness the power of your data. Unleash the potential of your people. Choose the analytics platform that disrupted the world of business intelligence. Choose Tableau.

User authentication through SAML does not apply to permissions and authorization for Tableau Online content, such as data sources and workbooks. It also does not control access to underlying data that workbooks and data sources connect to, you retain complete access permissions through your admin accounts as to what each employee has access to.

integrations.install_guide:
The Tableau Server [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Tableau Server. Your users log in to Tableau Server with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Tableau Server account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Callback URLURL to which the user is redirected after login (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
AudienceYour Tableau Server audience ({YOUR TABLEAU AUDIENCE}).
RecipientYour Tableau Server URL (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
DestinationYour Tableau Server URL (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Tableau Server.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Tableau Server To configure the integration with Tableau Server, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Tableau Server. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

install_guide_json.content: The Tableau Server Single Sign-on (SSO) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Tableau Server. Your users log in to Tableau Server with Auth0 identity providers, which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification.

Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • Sign up for a Tableau Server account.
  • Set up a connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

SettingDescription
Callback URLURL to which the user is redirected after login (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
AudienceYour Tableau Server audience ({YOUR TABLEAU AUDIENCE}).
RecipientYour Tableau Server URL (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
DestinationYour Tableau Server URL (http://{YOUR TABLEAU SERVER}/wg/saml/SSO/index.html).
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Tableau Server.

Configure integration with Tableau Server

To configure the integration with Tableau Server, follow the instructions listed in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Tableau Server. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view.
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: TelemetryTV
integrations.description: Manage your screens with a few clicks of your mouse. TelemetryTV’s content management and device management makes managing and deploying digital signage systems easier than ever before.
integrations.short_description: The easiest way to transform screens into a powerful engagement tool
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [TelemetryTV account](https://telemetrytv.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://user-api.telemetrytv.com/accounts/saml/response`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://user-api.telemetrytv.com/accounts/saml/response` |


## Configure integration with TelemetryTV

To configure the integration with **TelemetryTV**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to TelemetryTV.
2. Click on **Settings** > **Single Sign On** 
3. Insert your team name into the **Team Name** field
4. Insert the issuer into the **Entity ID (URN)** field
5. Insert the Identity Provider Login URL into the **Sign in URL** field
6. Copy and paste the x.509 certificate provided by Auth0.
7. The changes will be saved automatically

For more details, you can follow **TelemetryTV** [docs](http://help.telemetrytv.com/en/articles/3790506-using-single-sign-on-saml-with-telemetrytv).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to TelemetryTV. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Textmagic
integrations.description: TextMagic is an all-in-one text messaging service that allows SMBs to connect with their customers via two-way SMS, online texts, gateway SMS via email, SMS software for desktop, and SMS distribution lists, globally.
integrations.short_description: All-In-One Bulk SMS Service for Business
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Textmagic account](https://www.textmagic.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://my.textmagic.com/saml/acs`|

## Configure integration with Textmagic

To configure the integration with **Textmagic**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Textmagic.
2. Click on **Account** > **Account settings** 
3. Click on **Single Sign On**
3. Enter the following values:
    - Issuer on **Identity provider Entity ID**
    - Identity Provider URL on **Identity provider SSO URL** 
    - Open the certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it on **Public x509 certificate**
    - Chose a Log in option
4. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Textmagic** [docs](https://support.textmagic.com/article/single-sign-on-on-the-textmagic-account/).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Textmagic. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: ThousandEyes
integrations.description: ThousandEyes is a Digital Experience Monitoring platform that delivers visibility into the end-to-end path a website, app or service takes to get to its intended end-user. A real-time map for the always changing Internet, companies that rely on the Internet to deliver apps to customers or employees rely on ThousandEyes to make sure they can see, understand, and improve the delivery path so end users always have the best digital experience possible.
integrations.short_description: Multi-layered visibility from app to network to internet
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [ThousandEyes account](https://www.thousandeyes.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like ` https://app.thousandeyes.com/login/sso/acs`|

## Configure integration with Thousandeyes

To configure the integration with **Thousandeyes**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to ThousandEyes.
2. Click on **Hamburger Menu** > **Account Settings** > **Organization Settings**
3. Scroll to **Setup Single Sign-On** and click on ** Enable Single Sign On**.
4. Click on **Metadata File** on the **Configuration Type** option.
5. Upload the Identity Provider Metadata file.
6. Click on **Run Single Sign-On Test** and check it passes.
7. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **ThousandEyes** [docs](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/user-management/sso/how-to-configure-single-sign-on-sso-metadata).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to ThousandEyes. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Thycotic Secret Server
integrations.description: Secret Server is a surprisingly easy-to-use password management tool that enables you to start managing privileged accounts fast. Installation takes just 15 minutes, and you're up and running. A perfect solution for IT teams that don't yet have budget for a larger deployment.
integrations.short_description: Protect your privileged accounts with our enterprise-grade solution
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Secret Server account](https://thycotic.com/products/secret-server/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.secretservercloud.com/SAML/AssertionConsumerService.aspx`|
| Audience | Enter the Service Provider configured in Secret Server: e.g. “SecretServerServiceProvider”|

## Configure integration with Secret Server

To configure the integration with **Secret Server**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

Before start be sure your user has the **Administer Configuration SAML** assigned. More info in [configure permissions](https://docs.thycotic.com/ss/10.8.0/authentication/configuring-saml-sso/index.md#administer_configuration_saml_role_permission). 

1. Navigate to **Admin** > **Configuration** and click the **SAML** tab.
2. Click the Edit button in the **SAML General Settings** section.
3. Click to select the **SAML Enabled** check box and click the Save button.
4. Click the Edit button in the **SAML Service Providers** section.
5. Type a name for your SS service provider, such as SecretServerServiceProvider, in the **Name** text box.
6. Click the **Select Certificate** link and upload a valid certificate.
7. Click the **Create New Identity Provider** link. An Identity Provider popup appears.
8. Select **Import IDP from XML Metadata** option and select the metadata xml file from Auth0.

For more details, you can follow **Secret Server** [tutorial](https://docs.thycotic.com/ss/10.8.0/authentication/configuring-saml-sso/index.md).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Secret Server. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: UserEcho is an online customer support application in that allows to create helpdesk, ideas forum, livechat and knowledge base in one place that make it simple to provide great customer support.
integrations.short_description: UserEcho products help you to communicate effectively and resolve the needs of any business
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an UserEcho account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | ACS URL from UserEcho's SAML settings like `https://{domain}.userecho.com/saml/acs/`|

## Configure integration with UserEcho

To configure the integration with UserEcho, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your **Project Settings** 
2. On the main menu click on **Integrations > Website >  Single sign-on (SAML)** 
3. Fill in the **SAML SSO URL** and the **X.509 Certificate**
4. Save the changes
5. Go to **Project > Login settings**
6. Select **SAML redirect** as **Login type**
7. Save the changes

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to UserEcho. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Diagramming better, faster, together. Draw diagrams online anytime and anywhere collaboratively with your team in cloud. Import diagrams from the cloud to the desktop for performing enterprise scale of modelling and analysis with model traceability, versioning and traceability. Visual Paradigm Online is a much better alternative to LucidChart, SmartDraw, Viso, Concept Draw, Creately, Gliffy and etc.
integrations.short_description: VP Online, a suite of Powerful Online Tools that drives your business growth and improve project outcomes
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an [Visual Paradigm Online account](https://online.visual-paradigm.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login like `https://online.visual-paradigm.com/w/{id}/saml2/service/`|
| Audience | Service Provider Entity URL from within SSO_PROVIDER like `https://online.visual-paradigm.com/w/{id}/saml2` |

## Configure integration with Visual Paradigm Online

To configure the integration with **Visual Paradigm Online**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Visual Paradigm Online.
2. Click on **User Name** > **Administration** 
3. Click on **System Tools** and click on **Single Sign-On**.
4. Click on **Enable**
5. Insert Auth0 on the **Identity Provider (IDP) Name** field
6. Upload the Identity Provider Metadata file into the **Identity Provider Metadata** field.
7. Press **Save** to save the settings.

For more details, you can follow **Visual Paradigm Online** [docs](https://www.visual-paradigm.com/support/documents/teamcollaborationguide/2564/2567/86411_settingupvpo.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Visual Paradigm Online. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.description: Way We Do is cloud-based SOP Software that enables you to create, maintain and actively use a Business Operations Manual by making policies and procedures a natural part of daily workflow. Our practical tools are a perfect fusion of business process management, knowledge management and compliance. Managers assign tasks, create automatic reminders, and monitor workflow, while team members use procedures and follow processes from any location, so work is seamless and nothing is forgotten.
integrations.short_description: SOP Software that turns policies and procedures into Active Workflow
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Way We Do account](https://www.waywedo.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://{domain}.waywedo.com/SAML/AssertionConsumerService`|

## Configure integration with Way We Do

To configure the integration with **Way We Do**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Way We Do dashboard.
2. Click the person icon in the top right corner of any page in Way We Do, then click **Account** in the dropdown menu.
3. Click the menu icon to open the push navigation menu and click on **Single Sign On**.
4. Enable the **Turn on single sign-on** switch.
5. Enter a name to show in the login page in **Single sing-on name** (Auth0).
6. Enter the **Entity ID** with the Issuer URL.
7. Enter the **SAML SSO URL** with the Identity Provider Login URL.
8. Upload the IdP certificate in the **Certificate** file uploader.
9. You can disable the Way We Do Sign-On with **Enable passwords** and create users on the fly with **Enable auto-provisioning**.

For more details, you can follow **Way We Do** [docs](https://support.waywedo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000085336-Single-Sign-On).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Way We Do. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: WhosOff
integrations.description: WhosOff is an online leave management platform, enabling companies to manage their staff leave. WhosOff allows you to reduce the time spent on paper chasing leave requests around the office by making important information available to the required staff in your company. Integration with Auth0 provides companies with centralised access management so you are in control over user access to WhosOff, you even have the option to force users to login through Auth0, providing greater security control.
integrations.short_description: WhosOff is an online staff leave management platform.
integrations.install_guide:
Follow these instructions to configure your Auth0 account to connect to WhosOff for single sign on purposes. ## Prerequisites 1. An Auth0 account and tenant. [Sign up for free](https://auth0.com/signup). 2. A WhosOff account and you will need to be a registered super user on your WhosOff account. [Sign up for a long free trial](https://www.whosoff.com/sign-up) ## Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration 1. Select **Add Integration** (at the top of this page). 1. Read the necessary access requirements, and select **Continue**. 1. Enter a **Name**, then configure the integration using the following fields: * NO FIELDS REQUIRED 1. Enable the SSO integration by selecting **Save**. 1. Select the **Connections** view and [configure the sources of identity to use](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/applications/update-application-connections). ## Set up WhosOff To configure the integration with WhosOff, use the data shown in the **Tutorial** view to:
  1. Login at app.whosoff.com to your Whosoff account
  2. Using the left hand menu, head to administration/company settings
  3. Navigate to the tab 'Single Sign On'
  4. In the dropdown select your provider
  5. Click activate
  6. Once activated retrieve the Meta data file from your provider
  7. Return to Whosoff once set up to upload the Meta Data from the IdP
  8. After you have seletected the file and clicked 'Upload', ensure you save the whole form.
  9. Test the IdP initiated login first to make sure the account setup is correct and access is allowed
  10. After a successful SSO initiated login, to test Force SAML select the yes and save the form
  11. Then logout and attempt to login again at app.whosoff.com with the original credentials
  12. You should now be redirected to the IdP to confirm SSO login and returned to WhosOff on success.
## Troubleshooting For help and support visit [How to setup Auth0](https://www.whosoff.com/support/knowledgebase/How-to-setup-Auth0-SSO) or contact WhosOff support at [support@whosoff.com](mailto:support@whosoff.com).

integrations.name: WhosOffice
integrations.description:
WhosOffice is an online shift planning and people management platform, enabling companies to manage their workforce from a single location. Whether your team is based in one geographical location, or several, WhosOffice seamlessly keeps you in control of your work day operations so you always have the right team, in the right place, at the right time.

Integration with Auth0 provides companies with centralised access management so you are in control over user access to WhosOffice, you even have the option to force users to login through Auth0, providing greater security control.
integrations.short_description: Flawless shift planning and workforce management
integrations.install_guide: This integration will connect your Auth0 account with WhosOffice for single sign on. Use these instructions to link your Auth0 tenant to your WhosOffice accounts in order to authenticate using Auth0. If you require any assistance with this setup please contact [support@whosoffice.com](mailto:support@whosoffice.com). ## Prerequisites Before you begin: - You need to have an existing account with an Administrator role on WhosOffice to complete these steps. - You need to set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Identify your sub-domain from WhosOffice 1. Login to your WhosOffice account 2. From the **Settings** menu, go to **Company** 3. Make a note of your sub-domain on this page, it will be in bold as shown below. ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/whosoffice/media/whosoffice-sub-domain.png) ## Add this integration 1. Scroll to the top of this page and select **Add Integration** on the right. 2. Login, if prompted, then select a tenant. 3. Read the consent prompt that appears, then select **Continue**. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration 1. Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and select **Save**. 2. Replace `{sub-domain}` with your sub-domain retrieved above in both the **Audience** and **Callback URL** fields. 3. Select **Save**. 4. Select the **Tutorial** tab, then select **Download** next to "Identity Provider Metadata." This will download the metadata file to your computer. ## Configure integration with WhosOffice To configure the integration with WhosOffice, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). 1. In your WhosOffice account **Settings** menu, select **Company**. ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/whosoffice/media/whosoffice-settings-company.png) 2. Select the **Single Sign On** tab ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/whosoffice/media/whosoffice-single-sign-on.png) 3. Select **Auth0** from the provider drop down and select **Activate Login Provider**. 4. Using the form, browse to the SAML metadata file you downloaded in step 4 and select **Upload**. ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/whosoffice/media/whosoffice-upload.png) 5. Select **Save Changes** **Note:** If you would like to force users to Authenticate through Auth0 (for online logins only), make sure “Force SAML” is selected, then select **Save Changes**. ## Enable Connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to WhosOffice. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ## Test this integration 1. Ensure that you are logged out of your WhosOffice account 2. Navigate to `https://{sub-domain}.my.whosoffice.com` using your company sub-domain. * If you chose **Force SAML** during configuration, you will be automatically redirected to the Auth0 sign-in page. * If you did NOT choose **Force SAML**, you will see the WhosOffice login screen with an option to login through Auth0. ![](https://cdn.auth0.com/marketplace/catalog/content/assets/sso/whosoffice/media/whosoffice-login.png) 3. After you have authenticated your login with Auth0 you will be redirected to your WhosOffice account. For details on how to specify which users are able to use the WhosOffice connector from your Auth0 account, refer to the support section within Auth0.

install_guide_json.content:
This integration will connect your Auth0 account with WhosOffice for single sign on. Use these instructions to link your Auth0 tenant to your WhosOffice accounts in order to authenticate using Auth0.

If you require any assistance with this setup please contact support@whosoffice.com.

Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • You need to have an existing account with an Administrator role on WhosOffice to complete these steps.
  • You need to set up a Connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Identify your sub-domain from WhosOffice

  1. Login to your WhosOffice account
  2. From the Settings menu, go to Company
  3. Make a note of your sub-domain on this page, it will be in bold as shown below.

Add this integration

  1. Scroll to the top of this page and select Add Integration on the right.
  2. Login, if prompted, then select a tenant.
  3. Read the consent prompt that appears, then select Continue.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

  1. Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and select Save.
  2. Replace {sub-domain} with your sub-domain retrieved above in both the Audience and Callback URL fields.
  3. Select Save.
  4. Select the Tutorial tab, then select Download next to "Identity Provider Metadata." This will download the metadata file to your computer.

Configure integration with WhosOffice

To configure the integration with WhosOffice, follow the steps below with the data shown in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

  1. In your WhosOffice account Settings menu, select Company.

  1. Select the Single Sign On tab

  1. Select Auth0 from the provider drop down and select Activate Login Provider.
  2. Using the form, browse to the SAML metadata file you downloaded in step 4 and select Upload.

  1. Select Save Changes

Note: If you would like to force users to Authenticate through Auth0 (for online logins only), make sure “Force SAML” is selected, then select Save Changes.

Enable Connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to WhosOffice. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

Test this integration

  1. Ensure that you are logged out of your WhosOffice account
  2. Navigate to https://{sub-domain}.my.whosoffice.com using your company sub-domain.
  • If you chose Force SAML during configuration, you will be automatically redirected to the Auth0 sign-in page.
  • If you did NOT choose Force SAML, you will see the WhosOffice login screen with an option to login through Auth0.

  1. After you have authenticated your login with Auth0 you will be redirected to your WhosOffice account.

For details on how to specify which users are able to use the WhosOffice connector from your Auth0 account, refer to the support section within Auth0.

integrations.install_guide:
The Workday [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Workday. Your users log in to Workday with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Workday account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Callback URLURL to which the user is redirected after login (like https://impl.workday.com/{WORKDAY_TENANT_NAME}/login-saml.html).
RecipientThis should match the Callback URL value.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Workday.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Workday To configure the integration with Workday, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Workday. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

partner.description:
WorkOS empowers developers to accelerate their product’s growth by providing enterprise-ready features with ease. Through a powerful suite of APIs, WorkOS simplifies the integration of enterprise-grade functionalities like Single Sign-On (SSO), Directory Sync, Audit Logs, and more, enabling companies to meet the demands of large organizations without the complexity of building these systems from scratch.

By partnering with WorkOS, you’ll gain access to reliable tools that enhance your product’s appeal to enterprise customers, reducing time to market and engineering overhead. Trusted by startups and industry leaders alike, WorkOS delivers a scalable, secure, and developer-friendly solution to transform your application into an enterprise-ready powerhouse.

integrations.name: WorkOS
integrations.description:
WorkOS provides a modern API platform for implementing enterprise-grade authentication with ease. Save months of development time integrating and debugging SAML and OpenID Connect protocols.

WorkOS was designed to seamlessly fit into your existing application. With a few lines of code, you can offer the most popular enterprise sign-in options and support your biggest customers as quickly as possible.
integrations.short_description: Your app, Enterprise Ready
integrations.install_guide:
This guide will walk you through configuring SSO on WorkOS using Auth0 as the identity provider.

## Prerequisites

1. An Auth0 account and tenant. [Sign up for free](https://auth0.com/signup)  
1. A WorkOS account created with a non-consumer domain. [Sign up for free](https://workos.com/signup)  

## Set up WorkOS

1. Start by going to **Workspace -> Authentication tab**
1. Under **Authentication with Single Sign-On** box, click on **Enable Single Sign-On**
1. On **Select your identity provider** screen, select **Auth0**
1. See the **ACS URL** and **Audience** values to be used on the Auth0 integration configuration.

## Configure the Auth0 SSO Integration

1. Select **Add Integration** (at the top of this page).
1. Read the necessary access requirements, and select **Continue**.
1. Enter a **Name**, then configure the integration using the following fields from the previous section:
   * ACS URL
   * Audience
1. Enable the SSO integration by selecting **Save**.
1. Select the **Connections** view and [configure the sources of identity to use](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/applications/update-application-connections).

## Troubleshooting

1. If you are having issues with the integration, ensure the `ACS URL` and `Audience` values are correct.
1. If Enable Single Sign-On is not enabled, please check the following, ensure the domain is a non-consumer domain (e.g. `gmail.com`, `hotmail.com`, `yahoo.com` are consumer domains)
1. If you are still having issues, please contact [WorkOS support](https://workos.com/support). You can also create a Slack channel by clicking on **Create Slack Channel** on WorkOS dashboard Overview page.

integrations.short_description: Enable SSO with the Facebook Workplace platform
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for an Facebook Marketplace account.
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | ACS (Assertion Consumer Service) URL from within Facebook Workplace like `https://{domain}.workplace.com/work/saml.php`|
| Audience | Audience URL from within Facebook Marketplace like `https://www.workplace.com/company/{id}` |

## Configure integration with Facebook Marketplace

To configure the integration with Facebook Marketplace, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. In the **Admin Panel**, select **Security**
2. Click on the Authentication tab
3. Check the **Single Sign-On (SSO)** checkbox
4. Click **+Add New SSO Provider**
5. Fill in the values provided Auth0
6. Test the SSO and save

It is necessary to enable SSO login for the users
1. In the **Admin Panel**, select **People**
2. Search for the user that you want to enable for SSO
3. Click on the ... button and select **Edit Person's Details**
4. Select SSO at Log in with


## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Facebook Marketplace. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

install_guide_json.content:
Prerequisites

Before you begin:

  • Sign up for an Facebook Marketplace account.
  • Set up a Connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

Setting Description
Callback URL ACS (Assertion Consumer Service) URL from within Facebook Workplace like https://{domain}.workplace.com/work/saml.php
Audience Audience URL from within Facebook Marketplace like https://www.workplace.com/company/{id}

Configure integration with Facebook Marketplace

To configure the integration with Facebook Marketplace, follow the steps below with the data shown in the Tutorial view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

  1. In the Admin Panel, select Security
  2. Click on the Authentication tab
  3. Check the Single Sign-On (SSO) checkbox
  4. Click +Add New SSO Provider
  5. Fill in the values provided Auth0
  6. Test the SSO and save

It is necessary to enable SSO login for the users

  1. In the Admin Panel, select People
  2. Search for the user that you want to enable for SSO
  3. Click on the ... button and select Edit Person's Details
  4. Select SSO at Log in with

Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Facebook Marketplace. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

  1. Select the Connections view
  2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Workteam
integrations.description: Workteam is everything your team needs to plan and track deliverables and achieve great outcomes. With just a few clicks you can create a new plan, build a team, assign tasks and keep everyone up-to-date with the progress of work. Using standard social features, such as comments, likes and mentions, users can collaborate around individual work items to ensure great outcomes.
integrations.short_description: Transform organizational performance using OKRs and CFR
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Workteam account](https://workte.am/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://app.workte.am/_saml/validate/auth0`|

## Configure integration with Workteam

To configure the integration with **Workteam**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Workteam.
2. Click on **Organization settings** > **Integrations**.
3. On the **AUTHENTICATION & PROVISIONING** pane, click on the **Manage** button.
4. Click on **Enable** and enter the following values:
    - SAML IDP: Auth0
    - Identity Provider Login URL
    - Issuer
    - Open the certificate with a text editor and copy and paste it into Identity Provider Certificate
5. Press **OK** to save the settings.

This will turn Workteam authentication off except for admin users.

For more details, you can follow **Workteam** [docs](https://workte.am/articles/account-configuring-single-sign-on.html).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Workteam. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Wrike
integrations.description:
Wrike is the leading enterprise-grade collaborative work management platform that helps companies do their best work — no matter where their employees are based. With many companies moving to a remote work environment for their employees, Wrike is the best platform to ensure collaboration and deliver efficiencies for teams across the enterprise.

Over 20,000 customers and more than 2 million users use Wrike to connect geographically dispersed teams and to make sure their entire organizations are aligned, agile, and adaptable. With tailored solutions for marketing and creative teams, project management teams, product teams, professional services teams, and more, Wrike defines the next generation of work management worldwide.
integrations.short_description: Power the Modern, Agile Enterprise
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Wrike account](https://www.wrike.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.

| Setting | Description |
|-|-|
| Callback URL | URL to which the user is redirected after login `https://www.wrike.com/saml/SSO`|
| Audience | Audience URI `https://www.wrike.com`|

If you need a domain based SSO, please contact write Customer Support.
## Configure integration with Wrike

To configure the integration with **Wrike**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Log in to Wrike.
2. Click your profile picture.
3. Select **Settings** from the drop-down and click **Security** in the left panel.
4. On the **Security** page, scroll to the **SAML SSO** section.
5. Click the **Setup SAML SSO** button.
6. In the window that opens, select **Other** on the Identity Provider dropdown and click **Next**.
7. Here you can find the Wrike metadata XML file. Click **Next**.
8. You'll be asked to specify metadata from your provider. You can provide the **Identity Provider Metadata** url here o enter the XML as text. Click **Next**.
9. Wrike will set-up everything for you. Click **Enable SAML settings** button.
10. After an email verification you can save the SAML settings.

You can login to Wrike using the Auth0 login URL.

We recommend conducting user acceptance testing and testing different use cases immediately after SSO is enabled.

For more details, you can follow **Wrike** [docs](https://help.wrike.com/hc/en-us/articles/209605769-SSO-With-SAML-Implementation-Guide).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Wrike. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Yodeck
integrations.description: Yodeck is an extremely user-friendly cloud-based CMS built on the Raspberry Pi. Developed by Flipnode, a start-up based in San Francisco, CA, Yodeck lets users quickly and easily design and schedule a huge range of content, from images and videos to data dashboards and playlists, with professional results. Remote content and screen management is fully supported, while enterprise-grade security is also one of Yodeck’s assets.
integrations.short_description: Unbeatably easy digital signage
integrations.install_guide:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin:

- Sign up for a [Yodeck](https://www.Yodeck.com/).
- Set up a [Connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration and click **Save**.

## Configure integration with Yodeck

To configure the integration with **Yodeck**, follow the steps below with the data shown in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings).

1. Go to your Yodeck website and click to **Account Settings** > **SSO (Single Sign On)**.
2. Click **Enable SSO for users** and select **SAML** and expand the panel.
3. Check **Enable SAML**.
4. Select **Import From URL** or **Import From XML** and provide the **Identity Provider Metadata** from Auth0.
5. Click **Save**.

For more details, you can follow **Yodeck** [docs](https://www.yodeck.com/docs/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=10879187).

## Enable connections

Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Yodeck. By default, all configured connections are enabled.

1. Select the **Connections** view
2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them.

integrations.name: Zendesk
integrations.description:
By using Zendesk SSO with Auth0, we make it easy to for your support, sales, and customer engagement solutions. It’s quick to implement, easy to use, and scales to fit your needs. With Zendesk, it takes hours — not weeks — to get up and running.

Zendesk is easy to use, but it can be hard to deliver a customer experience that really stands out. We have the expertise to work as an extension of your team, ensuring our solutions have a strategic impact on your business. Together we can create a frictionless experience for your customers.
integrations.short_description: With Zendesk and Auth0 you can easily manage your users, enhance your team's productivity
integrations.install_guide:
The Zendesk [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Zendesk. Your users log in to Zendesk with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * Sign up for a Zendesk account. * [Set up a connection](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. Zendesk **requires** that all users have an email address. When enabling enterprise or social connections, make sure that they will provide an email address that can be sent to Zendesk. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Zendesk Account NameYour Zendesk account name.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Zendesk.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Zendesk To configure the integration with Zendesk, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Zendesk. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)

Prerequisites

  • Sign up for a Zendesk account.
  • Set up a connection, which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations.

Zendesk requires that all users have an email address. When enabling enterprise or social connections, make sure that they will provide an email address that can be sent to Zendesk.

Configure Auth0 SSO Integration

Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click Save.

SettingDescription
Zendesk Account NameYour Zendesk account name.
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Zendesk.

integrations.name: Zoom
integrations.description:
Single sign-on allows you to login using your company credentials. Zoom single sign-on (SSO) is based on SAML 2.0.

Zoom acts as the Service Provider (SP), and offers automatic user provisioning. You do not need to register as a user in Zoom. Once Zoom receives a SAML response from the Identity Provider (IdP), Zoom checks if this user exists. If the user does not exist, Zoom creates a user account automatically with the received name ID.
integrations.short_description: The leader in communications, with a cloud platform for video and audio conferencing
integrations.install_guide:
The Zoom [Single Sign-on (SSO)](https://auth0.com/docs/sso) Integration creates a client application that uses Auth0 for authentication and provides SSO capabilities for Zoom. Your users log in to Zoom with Auth0 [identity providers](https://auth0.com/docs/authenticate/identity-providers), which means the identity provider performs the identity credentials verification. ## Prerequisites Before you begin: * [Sign up for a Zoom account](https://zoom.us/signup). * [Apply for a Vanity URL with Zoom](https://zoom.us/account). * [Set up a connection](/identityproviders), which is a source of users. Connections can be databases, social identity providers, or enterprise identity providers, and can be shared among different applications. You may set up more than one connection for use with SSO integrations. ## Configure Auth0 SSO Integration Enter a name for your SSO Integration, configure the following settings, and click **Save**.
SettingDescription
Zoom Account NameYour Zoom account name. This is the first segment of your Vanity URL (for example, https://{account}.zoom.us).
Use Auth0 instead of the IdP to do Single Sign-on (SSO). **Legacy tenants only.**If enabled, Auth0 will handle SSO instead of Zoom.
![Save Integration](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_settings.png) ## Configure integration with Zoom To configure the integration with Zoom, follow the instructions listed in the **Tutorial** view (which will appear when you save the initial configuration settings). ## Enable connections Choose the connections to use with your SSO integration. Users in enabled connections will be allowed to log in to Zoom. By default, all configured connections are enabled. 1. Select the **Connections** view. 2. Toggle the sliders next to connection names to enable or disable them. ![Enable/Disable Connections](https://auth0.com/docs/media/articles/dashboard/sso-integrations/dashboard-integrations-sso-create_view-connections.png)
